terms.definition: Skills and techniques learned by survivors, usually through story events, and recorded on the Survivor Record Sheet.
The Watcher's instinct. Described on the Watcher's showdown story event and basic action card.
Add +1d10 movement to a move action. Before moving, you may roll the Death Die and add the result to your movement for one move action this round.
A gear special rule. Accessory gear may be worn in addition to armor on a hit location. Each accessory specifies the hit location it covers.
Represents permanent changes to attack rolls. Positive attribute adds to the dice roll, while negative attribute subtracts from the dice roll.
The number that each attack roll result must meet or exceed in order to be considered a hit. Listed on monster attack profiles and weapon gear.
An ability. Add 1d10 strength to wound attempts when attacking with Fist & Tooth.

The part of the survivors' turn in which an individual survivor gains movement and activation. Each survivor must complete their act before another may start theirs, and all unused movement and activations are lost when a survivor ends their act.
Most things a survivor or monster can do during the Showdown Phase, like moving and attacking, are actions.
Activation can be spent to attack, activate some gear, and interact with terrain. Survivors gain one activation during that survivor's act.
A gear special rule. A survivor may only activate/spend {q} on this gear the listed number of times during a showdown.
A miniature is adjacent to another when it occupies a space one space in a cardinal (non-diagonal) direction from a square occupied by the other miniature.
An ability. You may set aside 2 dice with the High Roller knowledge. These dice must be from separate attacks.
The Tyrant's instinct. Described on the Tyrant's showdown story event and basic action card.

A knowledge advances when appropriate observation conditions are met. Advancing a knowledge transforms it into something more powerful. When this happens, immediately replace the old knowledge with the new one on your survivor record sheet. Update your knowledge deck and the settlement record sheet, if applicable.
A type of gear special rule. Having the indicated number of colored affinities will trigger the effect. Each affinity bonus only applies once, regardless of how many extra affinities a survivor has.

Some gear cards have red, blue, or green half-squares on the card edge. If a half-square is adjacent to a half-square of the same color on another gear card, the complete square they form is one affinity.
The Hyper Light neurosis. The symptoms return the moment you stop moving. At the end of your act, if you did not dash this round, you are knocked down and gain a bleeding token.

An attack trigger found on some monster AI attack profiles. If there are any successful hits in the attack, resolve all damage from all hits in this attack (roll hit location dice, apply damage to hit location), then apply this trigger's attack effects. If there is no damage dealt from the attack, do not apply this effect.
An attack trigger found on some monster AI attack profiles. If there are any successful hits in the attack, before rolling hit location dice, apply this trigger's attack effects.
The end of a Showdown Phase. Contains different outcomes based on the survivors' success or failure.
An ability. You may hunt if you are retired. When you gain Hunt XP, you may instead choose not to gain it.

A secret fighting art from the Lion Knight expansion. It allows the survivor to rotate up to 3 gear cards in their gear grid. Each of these gear cards may be rotated 90, 180, or 270 degrees in either direction, as long as the card remains aligned with the printed square on the survivor's gear grid. This changes the positions of the affinities and arrows on those gear cards. The rules of the cards themselves remain unchanged.
Add an attack roll to an attack. During your attack, after making your attack rolls but before drawing hit locations, you may roll the Death Die as an additional attack roll.
AI cards are made up of actions, flows and alerts. Some cards also have persistent injury and/or definition boxes. There are four kinds of AI cards - Basic, Advanced, Legendary, and Special.
Made up of AI cards used for a specific showdown. See the monster's story event for details of its AI deck. The AI Deck is reduced as the monster is wounded.

Actions following an alert contain important conditional information that must be considered to determine if the action is performed. Continue to perform any further actions on the AI card unless stated otherwise. Survival may not be spent during an alert.
The Gold Smoke Knight's instinct. Described on the Gold Smoke Knight's showdown story event and basic action card.
An effect during the showdown that refers to all survivors applies to all survivors currently on the showdown board.
A gear keyword. This gear is substantively crafted of amber.

If the monster moves into the survivors' hunt board space, it ambushes the survivors. End any current hunt events and start the showdown immediately. Survivors skip their first turn. In most cases, this means that the monster will take two turns in a row.

Some hunt events allow the survivors to ambush the monster. If they do, survivors may go first in the showdown. Do not follow the setup rules on the monster's story event. Instead, place the listed showdown terrain, the monster, and survivors on the showdown board as the players decide (setup rules on terrain cards must still be followed).
A gear special rule. You must have a bow in your gear grid to activate this card. Ammo has the range of a bow in your gear grid.
A gear keyword. This gear is ammunition for another weapon gear.
The Slenderman's instinct. Described on the Slenderman's showdown story event and basic action card.
An ability. At the start of the survivors' turn, if you are adjacent to the monster, reveal the top AI card, then place it back on top of the deck.

An impairment. It takes one fewer bleeding token to kill you. This impairment can be gained multiple times. If you gain Anemic enough times that it takes 0 bleeding tokens to kill you, you instantly die.

Remove this card from play and return it to the game box. Unless it is recorded into settlement storage or the survivor's record sheet, any archived card is permanently lost. It must be returned to its respective deck and be re-drawn to be gained again.

Gear with this keyword is armor. Protects the survivor from injury. Each piece of armor will have the hit location symbol for the hit location it can be worn on. Each hit location may only wear one piece of armor.

Recorded on the survivor record sheet. Determined by armor gear in the survivor's gear grid, as well as other effects and events. Each point negates one point of damage to the hit location. Armor points decrease by 1 for each damage they negate.

Each armor set is comprised of all armor from a single settlement location with the keyword 'set'. For example, while a survivor is wearing the White Lion Helm, White Lion Gauntlets, White Lion Coat, White Lion Skirt, and White Lion Boots, they have completed the White Lion armor set.
A survivor wearing a completed armor set gains the benefits of the armor set bonus listed on its corresponding armor set card.
A survivor hit location. Damage to the arms beyond the heavy injury level results in a roll on the Arms section of the Severe Injury table.
The start of the showdown. Any survivors who have "On Arrival" effects apply them in the order of their choice.
The Marrowism neurosis. When you gain knowledge at the Forum that is not from Marrowism, it costs +2 lumi. You cannot refuse a Majestic Invitation from a Bone Eater.
A gear keyword. This gear card is an arrow.
An ability. Add +4 to your roll results during {s} Vaultless.
A survivor ability. On Arrival, if possible, add an Acanthus Plant terrain card to the showdown.
An ability. When you make an observation about a knowledge, make two observations instead.
The process of making attack rolls and resolving damage, wounds, or other effects.

Attack effects are rules contained in a box below the attack profile on some AI cards, and applied when the trigger occurs. These effects are applied only once, even if the target is hit or damaged multiple times by this attack.
Part of monster AI cards and basic actions. Lists the speed, accuracy, damage, and any triggers for a monster attack.
The dice roll that represents an attempt to hit a target. A Lantern 10 will always result in a hit.
An aspect of a survivor or monster described by a numerical value.

Attribute modifier tokens are used to indicate temporary changes to attributes. Attribute modifier tokens are double-sided to represent gains and losses for that attribute, and are combined with permanent attribute totals to determine the current level of each attribute. All tokens are removed at the end of each showdown.

Automatic hits happen in the place of attack rolls. When a survivor attacks, they make attack rolls equal to their weapon's Speed (plus modifiers). Each automatic hit foregoes one of these rolls and adds 1 to the total number of hits when hits are determined. The remaining attack rolls are performed normally, and all hits (rolled or automatic) are drawn and resolved together. Automatic hits are not Perfect hits.
A movement that puts the most possible spaces between two points on the showdown board, such as a monster, survivor, terrain, or board edge.
Gear with this keyword is an axe weapon. Survivors may gain levels of axe weapon proficiency with this weapon.
The direction opposite the monster's facing.

A gear special rule. Spend {q} and archive X cards from the monster's wound stack to perform a Ballad. Ballads have different names and costs (denoted by [X]). Effects of Ballads last until the end of the Showdown Phase unless the gear that features it is archived or the survivor performing it dies. Only one Ballad may be performed at a time among all survivors unless an effect instructs otherwise.
A gear keyword. Balm items work by rubbing them on a survivor's skin.

A special rule. At the start of your act, gain (or lose) howling tokens until you have X of them. During your act or a survival opportunity, you may spend 1 howling token to do one of the following: gain {a}, which must be spent immediately, limit once per round. Gain {q}, which must be spent immediately, limit once per round. Perform a survival action using the howling token in place of survival. Gain +1 STR token until the end of the round.
A gear special rule. On a Perfect hit, gain +X strength for the rest of the attack.
Causes survivors to be knocked down.

A Monster's basic action is detailed on its Basic Action card. A basic action consists of a target action and an attack action with an attack profile. Monsters will perform a basic action on some AI cards, in some reactions, or if the AI deck and discard are both empty. Performing a basic action does not count as an AI card being drawn.
Double-sided Basic Action/Reference cards contain a monster's basic action on one side and an overview of the monster's characteristics on the other side.
100 events survivors may encounter out in the darkness. Found in the Basic Hunt Event section of the rulebook.
Generic resources that can be gained from most quarry monsters and many events.
A trigger found on some monster attack profiles. Apply this trigger's attack effect after hits and hit location dice are rolled, but before damage is dealt to hit locations.
An ability. On Arrival, gain +1 evasion token. When you suffer a severe injury, adjacent survivors and monsters are knocked down. Limit once per showdown.
An impairment. You are always stinky. You do not generate endeavors. When a survivor ends their movement adjacent to you, they suffer 1 brain damage.
An ability. You may spend survival and use fighting arts, weapon specialization, and weapon mastery while Frenzied.

Survivors can gain bleeding tokens from severe injuries, monster attacks, and some events. If a survivor has 5 or more bleeding tokens, they are dead. All tokens are removed at the end of each showdown.
The target gains X bleeding tokens.
A gear special rule. When you wound the monster from its blind spot with this gear, all of its {r} REFLEX become {r} FAILURE until the attack ends. (This includes the current reaction.)
Usually the spaces directly behind the monster. Survivors in the monster's blind spot are outside of its field of view, and gain +1 accuracy when attacking.

A gear special rule. Spend {q} to ignore X hits the next time you are attacked. Lasts until your next act. A survivor may not use block more than once per attack. When you Block X, lose all deflect tokens.
A gear special rule. If you are adjacent to another survivor, you may spend {q} to kill them. You gain their bleeding tokens and it takes an additional 5 bleeding tokens to kill you this showdown.
A gear special rule. When you activate this gear, gain a bleeding token.

A survivor hit location. Damage to the body beyond the heavy injury level results in a roll on the Body section of the Severe Injury table. This is the only hit location that appears twice on the hit location dice.
An attack that always hits a survivor's body location. Do not roll hit location dice for this attack.
Some survivors track their Body Count, which is the number of survivors they have killed.
A gear keyword. Bone is one of the primary materials used to craft this gear.
A common resource keyword.
An ability. At the start of your act, gain +1 strength token. When you are knocked down, lose all your +1 strength tokens. When you have five or more +1 strength tokens, your heart bursts. Dead.
An ability. When you spend {m}, you must place yourself in an unoccupied space 5 spaces away from your current space and gain a +1 speed token for the rest of the round.
Gear with this keyword is a bow weapon. Survivors may gain levels of bow weapon proficiency with this weapon.

The Brain is a survivor location different from hit locations, and represents a survivor's mental fitness. Since the human mind is fragile, there is only one injury level for the Brain (indicated by the light-lined unfilled box). Any damage beyond the light injury level results in a roll on the Brain Trauma table. The Brain is only damaged by brain damage.
Brain damage only affects the Brain location.
Contains possible outcomes of excess damage to the Brain location.
A basic resource with the Scrap keyword.
An impairment. If any survivors with 0 Hunt XP in your hunting party die during the hunt or showdown, you retire.
When a new location is built, place that settlement location in the play area and add the new location to your settlement record sheet. This is a permanent addition to your settlement.
An ability. Add +1 to your head severe injury roll results. Double your courage for any rolls that would take it into account.
An ability. You are immune to bash.

A specific type of Strain Milestone that is checked at the end of a Campaign. If achieved, resolve its Permanent Effect and remove the achieved strain milestone card from your game. It can never be used again.
A gear special rule. This gear may only be activated X times per campaign. Record this on your settlement record sheet to keep track.

A canceled attack immediately ends. Discard all unresolved hit locations. Do not perform any actions, special rules, critical effects, or reactions on these cards. This most commonly happens when the attacker is knocked down, draws a trap card, or is no longer in range of the monster during their attack.
A wanderer ability. When you archive a resource with Phantom Friend, gain a random Unique soda gear and +1 permanent affinity of your choice.

A survivor ability. Before making an attack roll, you may declare "Caratosis X" in a loud, booming voice. If you do, that attack gains X automatic hits. X cannot be more than your total red affinities. When the attack ends, gain +X Hunt XP.

A survivor status. When you gain this, place all your attribute tokens on this card. At the start of your act, remove a token from this card and suffer 3 damage to a random hit location. When there are no tokens on this card, archive it.
The Lion Knight's instinct. Described on the Lion Knight's showdown story event and basic action card.

A gear special rule. This gear must be placed in the center of your gear grid. If you gain this and already have a gear in the center of your grid, archive it and place this in the center of your grid.
A card that modifies how a survivor comes into the world. Character cards will bestow small benefits or penalties on newly named survivors.

A gear special rule. Survivors spend movement and activation to move the maximum available spaces in a straight line in one direction. At the end of movement, if in range, perform an attack using a melee weapon, adding the number of spaces moved in this way to your strength for the attack. Charge does not impact any further attacks this turn.
If you have a Charged token at the end of your attack with a metal weapon, if you hit the monster, it is shocked and suffers an automatic wound. Archive all Charged tokens at the end of each round.
An ability. Spend {v}{v} to cause departing survivors to suffer the frenzy brain trauma twice and ignore bash for the rest of the lantern year. Limit once per lantern year.
A special newborn blessed under a Solar Eclipse. Some cards and story events care about Children of the Sun.
A gear special rule. When you attempt to wound a hit location with a persistent injury, gain +X luck for that wound attempt.

A gear special rule. You may spend MA to activate and attack with this weapon. If you do, it gains the two-handed keyword, +4 strength, and slow for the attack. You cannot use Cleave if an injury or other effect is preventing you from activating gear with the two-handed keyword.
Gear with this keyword is a cleaver. Cleaver is a novel weapon proficiency type and cannot normally be selected.
A gear special rule. Gain +X strength while attempting to wound a Super-Dense hit location.
An impairment. Gain +6 permanent luck. At the start of your act, suffer -1 permanent luck. When you have 0 or less permanent luck, suffer the head explosion severe injury.
The survivor the least number of cardinal spaces away from the monster.
The threat the least number of cardinal spaces away from the monster.
An armor set bonus. You are Clothed & Satiated if you are wearing armor gear at 3+ different hit locations. You cannot claim this if you have already claimed an armor set bonus.
Gear with this keyword is a club weapon. Survivors may gain levels of club weapon proficiency with this weapon.

A type of hit location card. Wound attempts against a Coagulated hit location are automatic failures unless the attack can reach and is within line of sight of the highlighted space on the hit location card. To draw a random Coagulated hit location card, draw from the bottom of the Enchanted Flesh deck and place it atop the hit location deck. If an effects instructs you to find a specific Coagulated hit location, look through the deck, set the card aside, shuffle the searched deck(s), and place the specific card atop the hit location deck.

The accumulated sum of nutrients in a settlement's diet. Affects certain benefits commensurate with CC milestones. A quarry monster grants {l} CC the first {l} times it is defeated. (A Level 2 Phoenix grants 2 CC the first two times it is defeated.) Nemesis monsters grant 3 CC regardless of monster level and only once per level.

A deck of cards that represent the benefits bestowed upon a settlement as they earn more CC. During the Check Milestones step of the settlement phase, if the settlement has earned enough CC, reveal the top card of the CC rewards deck and perform its effects.

If a monster moves through a space occupied by a survivor, they collide and the survivor suffers collision. If a monster ends its movement on a survivor, they collide, the survivor suffers collision and knockback 5. If a survivor is knocked back into impassable terrain, they collide with it and the survivor suffers collision. If a survivor suffers knockback into another survivor, complete the knockback movement normally. Both survivors suffer collision at the end of knockback. If the survivors would occupy the same space, instead place the knocked back survivor in the closest unoccupied space.
When a survivor suffers collision, they are knocked down.
The Champion neurosis. You must depart each lantern year. If you are unable to depart, you do so anyway but set your survival and insanity to 0.
The Effervescence neurosis. On Arrival, Candy gains a random disorder. If all her disorder slots are already filled, she instead gains +1 permanent systemic pressure and suffers -1 disposition.
Compulsive reactions are always performed and cannot be canceled by any effect.

You need to focus your mind to perform extraordinary feats. At the start of your act declare your intent to Concentrate. Immediately end your act and attempt to Concentrate until the start of your next act. To successfully Concentrate you cannot: perform any kind of actions, move for any reason, suffer knocked down, suffer any kind of damage, gain any bleeding or negative attribute tokens.

When a survivor is instructed to move consecutive spaces, they must move without occupying the same space more than once. A survivor could not, for example, move back and forth between two spaces to fulfill consecutive space movement. They could, however, move around a monster or move in a straight line.

Constellations are powerful upgrades available only to People of the Stars. Survivors can only have one constellation. Once a survivor has gained a constellation, they no longer record new Dragon Traits on their record sheet. If a survivor would gain two or more constellations at the same time, they choose which of them to gain.
A keyword. This is easily edible.
A special rule. Something that may be ingested for the listed result. It may be archived after use.
The Dragon King's instinct. Described on the Dragon King's showdown story event and basic action card.
An encounter monster deck. Counter cards dictate how an encounter monster will respond to the survivors' actions. Each monster has its own unique Counter conditions.

A survivor attribute listed on the survivor record sheet. Courage is a survivor's potentially ill-advised bravery, Reaching a courage level of 3 will trigger the Bold Story Event, while reaching a level of 9 will trigger the See the Truth Story Event.
An impairment. When you would die or cease to exist, you instead retreat to safety and rejoin the survivors during the Aftermath.

The Consumption neurosis. If Aeneas is Hungry, she consumes and archives 1 consumable resource or gear in the settlement (including settlement storage) at the start of the Develop Step of the settlement phase.

Critical wounds are lucky blows that always wound a monster, even if the wound attempt does not exceed the monster's toughness. A critical wound occurs when a wound roll result is a Lantern 10 on a hit location with a critical wound effect. The luck attribute modifies the roll needed for a critical wound.
An encounter most deck. When a survivor rolls a critical wound against an encounter monster, draw a card from this deck and follow its instructions.

Critical wound effects on monster AI cards are represented by the critical wound symbol, followed by rules that specify what happens when a monster is critically wounded at that location. Critical wounds effects are not reactions. On a critical wound, cancel all reactions on that hit location card.

A terrain rule. Survivors cannot voluntarily move onto crumbling terrain. Survivors can be placed on or suffer knockback into crumbling terrain. When they do, they collide with it painfully. Replace the crumbling terrain with a Rubble terrain tile. The survivor suffers 1 damage to a random hit location. When a monster collides with crumbling terrain, replace it with a Rubble terrain tile.

You ignore cursed and cannot wear armor. When you depart gain 3 to all hit locations. Suffer -2 to the result of all severe injury rolls. When you participate in Intimacy, newborns gain Crystal Skin in addition to any other roll results.
A gear special rule. Survivors must spend both movement and activation to activate Cumbersome gear.

A monster AI card effect. The shock arcs through you to a survivor with metal gear up to X spaces away. This cannot arc to a survivor who has already suffered damage from this attack. Perform this attack profile on the new survivor.
A gear special rule. This gear cannot be removed from the gear grid for any reason. If the survivor dies or ceases to exist, archive this gear.
An ability. On a Perfect hit, gain {q} after your attack ends, which must be spent immediately. Limit once per round.

A hundred-sided die. This is accomplished by using 2d10, with one die nominated to represent the "tens" digit and the other to represent the "ones" digit. Note that a roll showing 2 lanterns (result of 10 on each) indicates a result of 100.
Roll 1d10, divide the result by two and round up to the nearest whole number.
Gear with this keyword is a dagger weapon. Survivors may gain levels of dagger weapon proficiency with this weapon.
The amount of damage dealt for each hit in a monster's attack. Roll separate hit locations for each hit.
Damage is added to the damage listed on an attack profile to calculate the total damage of an attack.
A hit damages a survivor if it removes armor points or causes an injury. Hits which are dodged, blocked, or ignored do not cause damage.
A type of observation. Filling in observation boxes on knowledges with dangerous observations can have negative consequences for the survivor or settlement.
An ability. Increase your range of Perfect hits by 1. When you are a returning survivor, roll 1d10. If the result is less than or equal to your HuntXP, you leave the settlement forever.

A survival action. When opportunity permits, a survivor may spend 1 survival to dash. They gain +1{m} which must be spent immediately. Each survivor may only Dash once per round, and only after the settlement has innovated the Paint innovation.
When a monster or survivor is dazed, they gain a -1 speed token until the end of their turn. Monsters and survivors can only be dazed once per round.
An ability. When you die, do not gain the benefits of your Death principle. Instead, gain +1 population. This new survivor adopts the Deadism philosophy, gains Dead Again, and has your name.
A survivor impairment. Survivors with Dead Inside cannot gain survival.
A gear special rule. Gain +X luck while attacking with this weapon. This increases the odds of inflicting critical wounds. (If no numerical value is specified, aka Deadly, it is just +1 luck.)
The survivor cannot hear, or be impacted by encourage and other audible effects.

Part of the settlement record sheet. During the Settlement Phase, if any survivors perished during the previous Hunt or Showdown Phase, update the death count. If survivors perish during the Settlement Phase, update the death count immediately. The first time a settlement's death count is updated, trigger the Principle: Death story event.

A survivor status. A survivor with Death Count will gain +1 survival at the end of each round and place a death count token on this card. They may surge an additional time for each token on Death Count. When there are 5+ tokens on Death Count, the survivor dies instantly.

A special orange ten-sided die. The Death Die replaces the Monster Controller tile. The player of the survivor with the Death Die controls the monster. At the start of the showdown, the player with the Final Lantern starts with the Death Die on Horripilation. At the start of each subsequent round, pass the Death Die to the Horripilation card to the left. The Watcher's final emanations continue to jump between lanterns of survivors that cannot act, including dead or absent survivors. Instead of the benefits on the Monster Controller tile, you may use Pulse Discoveries based on your settlements Lantern Research Level. Once per round, the survivor with the Death Die may use one of the settlement's unlocked Pulse Discoveries. After rolling the Death Die, return it to its current Horripilation card. In the Final Lantern is lost or archived, it is gone forever. Survivors cannot use the Death Die. Return to using the Monster Controller tile.
A gear special rule. Spend {m}{m} to place yourself in an unoccupied space adjacent to a monster or survivor. If it is a survivor, you both suffer {l} brain damage.
A gear keyword. This gear is substantively crafted of deathmetal.
A resource keyword. Certain gear requires deathmetal to craft.
A monster is defeated when it is wounded and there are no AI cards in the AI deck or AI discard pile to move to the wound stack.

A survivor can die in a variety of ways. Remove their miniature from the board. They can no longer participate in the hunt or showdown. Return their gear to the settlement storage and move their resources to another survivor. If all the survivors die during the showdown, all of their gear returns to the settlement and all resources not in the settlement storage are lost.
A token acquired via certain knowledges, terrain tiles, and gear. Death tokens can be used or consumed for a variety of effects.
When the survivors are defeated by a monster, follow the defeat rules in the Aftermath section of the monster's story event.
The Dung Beetle Knight's instinct. Described on the Dung Beetle Knight's showdown story event and basic action card.

A gear special rule. Spend {q} to gain (or lose) deflect tokens until you have X of them. When you are hit, if you have any deflect tokens, you ignore that hit and lose a deflect token. When you Deflect X, you lose the benefits of Block.
A gear special rule. Spend {q} to archive an adjacent impassable terrain tile. If a monster is standing on that terrain when it is archived, the monster is knocked down.
These rules apply to departing survivors at the end of the Settlement Phase.
The survivors nominated to take part in the next hunt and showdown.
An attack effect that reduces armor points of a survivor hit location to 0 before applying damage.

A terrain special rule. When a survivor collides with destructible terrain, stop their movement and archive the terrain. The survivor suffers 1 damage to a random hit location. When a monster collides with destructible terrain, archive the terrain.
An ability. At the end of your act, gain +3 insanity if you have attacked this round. Otherwise, suffer 3 brain damage.
A gear special rule. When a devastating weapon wounds a monster, it will inflict X additional wounds.
The Romanticism neurosis. When you depart, gain a random knowledge from the knowledge deck. If you have no empty knowledge slots, you must replace an existing knowledge.

During the Atlas showdown, survivors may suffer knockback in specific cardinal directions. When a card instructs a survivor to suffer directional knockback, refer to the North Star object to see which way your survivor will move.

When a survivor suffers disarm or is disarmed, end their attack. Place a disarm tile on the attacking weapon and a matching tile 5 spaces away from that survivor. The survivor may not activate the weapon until they remove the tile on it or the showdown ends. When a survivor moves over the associated tile, archive it and remove the matching tile from your gear grid. Fist & Tooth and gear with the Locked special rule cannot be disarmed. If a survivor suffers disarm or is disarmed but is not attacking, choose a weapon in their gear grid to disarm and perform the effect as normal.
Put the card into the appropriate discard pile. It is no longer in play.
An ability. When you roll on a table while ranking up your philosophy, you may choose your roll result instead of rolling.
The Phoenix's instinct. Described on the Phoenix's showdown story event and basic action card.
The Deadism neurosis. You cannot gain insanity.

A mental impairment. Disorders are found on disorder cards. When a disorder is gained, record its rules on the survivor record sheet and return the card to the box. Survivors can have up to 3 disorders. Additional disorders gained must replace a disorder of your choice. If a survivor would gain a disorder they already have, nothing happens.

A characteristic unique to Wanderers, represented by a heart. Disposition represents how a Wanderer feels about the settlement they are in. It can go up and down during a campaign. This may have great influence on a Wanderer's ranking up.
A special survival action. When the White Lion would Grab another survivor, spend 1 survival to distract it and roll 1d10. On a 6+, place the survivor in the monster's blind spot instead.
A gear special rule. If the monster would collide with you during its move action, spend 2 survival to roll 1d10. On a 10+, it ends it movement adjacent to you and is knocked down.

A survival action. When a survivor is hit, after rolling hit location dice but before damage, they may spend 1 survival to dodge, canceling one hit. The dodged hit becomes a failed attack roll and does not cause damage. Any additional un-dodged hits resolve normally. Dodge is the only survival action that knocked down survivors can perform. Each survivor may only Dodge once per round.
When a survivor is dominated, they are knocked down and cannot be encouraged or fist pumped. They are no longer dominated when they stand.

A gear special rule. This gear is unresponsive outside the most terrible of circumstances. When you become doomed, place a doom token on this gear. You must spend both {q} and a doom token on this gear to activate it.

While a survivor is doomed, they cannot perform any actions or spend survival. If a survivor is doomed by a monster's AI or Hit Location card, they are doomed until all actions on the card are performed and the card is resolved.

A survivor ability. When you suffer damage, you may declare "Dormenatus X" in a loud, booming voice. If you do, add X armor points to each hit location. X cannot be more than your total green affinities. After the damage is resolved, gain +X Hunt XP.

A double-sided innovation has two sides with two distinct innovations. A settlement may only have one of them at a time. If the settlement gains one innovation while it has the other, simply flip the innovation card to reflect this change and modify your settlement record sheet as appropriate.

These terrain tiles have two corresponding terrain cards. Use the rules on the terrain card corresponding to the currently visible side of a terrain tile. Outside of specific showdowns, you will only use the side of the terrain tile corresponding to the terrain card you drew.

Dragon Traits are a collection of abilities, fighting arts, attribute modifiers, disorders, secret fighting arts, and surnames that survivors gain throughout a People of the Stars campaign. Dragon Traits are mentioned in bold, red text to remind players to mark them on their record sheet as they are gained. Once marked, Dragon Traits are permanent. Even if a survivor loses the original source of the trait, they are still considered to have that Dragon Trait. When a survivor has four Dragon Traits in a row (vertically or horizontally), they gain a Constellation via the Faces in the Sky story event.

The monster controller draws the top AI card of the monster's AI deck and plays it. If the AI deck is empty, shuffle the discard pile into it and draw the top card. If the AI deck and discard pile are empty, the monster performs its Basic Action.

A burden borne by the Scout of Death. When a scout departs the settlement, they must take this with them and use the associated scout gear grid. The scout suffers -2 movement and their gear grid is reduced by 5 gear slot from the bulk of the Dreaded Pack. If all is Lost to the Darkness during Logistics of Death (page 141), the pack is also lost and the settlement cannot nominate a scout unless they craft another Dreaded Pack.
An ability. During the showdown, if you have at least 1 permanent luck, you may set your luck to 0 and physically flip any token.
A resource keyword. Dung is prized by the Dung Beetle Knight.

Duration cards are drawn twice. The first time a duration card is drawn, perform any "when drawn face down" actions. Then, instead of discarding it, place the duration card face up on top of the AI deck. The next time a monster draws an AI card, it draws the duration card for a second time. Perform any "when drawn face up" actions, then discard the card after resolving. Some duration cards have persistent effects while they are face up on top of the AI deck.
A gear special rule. When any of your attack roll results are a 1, cancel your attack.

A terrain rule. Survivors cannot voluntarily move onto elastic terrain. They can be placed on or suffer knockback into elastic terrain. When they do, they collide with it. Survivors that suffer knockback into elastic terrain increase their knockback by 4 and change the bounce direction of their knockback (see Black Knight rulebook for more).
Survivors are elevated while atop specific terrain. They can move normally and ignore obstacles when drawing a line of sight. Monsters may always draw a line of sight to them.
A unique survival action in People of the Sun. Once per round, if you have no +1 strength tokens, spend 1 survival to gain a +1 strength token. When you are knocked down, lose all +1 strength tokens.
A resource keyword. It makes you feel.

A special survival action. If adjacent to the Crimson Crocodile, spend 1 survival to illuminate the scales before you attack. During that attack, you can always reach the weak point on Coagulated hit locations.

A type of showdown. Encounters may occur randomly during the hunt phase and offer additional challenges and rewards to players who choose to include them in their campaign. Each encounter has different rules, but all encounters take place on an encounter board. See the appropriate encounter setup page for more detailed information.

A survival action. A standing survivor may spend 1 survival at any time to encourage a knocked down survivor, letting them stand. Deaf survivors may not be encouraged. Each survivor may only Encourage once per round, and only if the settlement has the Language innovation.

Each returning survivor contributes +1 endeavor (+1{t}) to the settlement. Survivors can spend endeavors to innovate, build new settlement locations, or perform unique actions. To spend an endeavor, nominate a survivor, reduce the settlement's total endeavors by 1, and follow the rules for the action the endeavor was spent on. Unless stated otherwise, the action's effects apply only to the nominated survivor.
A wanderer impairment. This impairment cannot be removed for any reason. You cannot {s} Run Away or {s} Logistics of Death. You play with the Dual Modes - Hungry / Content tile.
An impairment. When you *depart*, *departing survivors* gain +1 insanity. You cannot encourage.

You may spend 7 survival minus your Luck to ignore a severe injury before you roll a result. Your Luck is determined by the sum of your permanent luck attribute, any luck modifiers, and any other gear or abilities affecting your luck at the time you endure.
A card used by the King. Energy cards are required to perform some {O}. When you put an energy card into play, perform the actions listed on the card.
An ability. Once per showdown, you may archive a Nightmare Tick vermin resource to remove all your bleeding tokens and fully heal yourself.

A knowledge undergoes an epiphany when appropriate observation conditions are met. Epiphanies transform a knowledge into a new form. When this happens, immediately add the new knowledge to your arc survivor record sheet (and knowledge deck, if new). Unlike Advancing, you do not erase or forget the old knowledge in this process unless specified.
Equipping refers to putting a piece of weapon gear into your gear grid. If an effect restricts the type of gear you can equip, you cannot place that type of gear into your gear grid.
A gear special ability. This gear is inextricably linked to saviors. When the settlement has no savior, archive this gear.

When a monster or survivor with evasion is the target of an attack, increase the accuracy on the attack profile by the amount of evasion the target possesses. Evasion can be a negative number, in which case it is subtracted from the attack profile's accuracy. Regardless of evasion, a Lantern 10 on the attack roll is always a Perfect Hit, and an attack roll result of 1 will always be unsuccessful.

Some damage is incurred from events. Typically, this damage cannot be dodged or blocked. Event damage is non-lethal, and will reduce armor points and cause light and heavy injuries, but will not cause severe injuries or brain trauma.
The event revealer reveals a hunt event, reads it aloud, and follows the rules on the card, making all decisions along for that hunt event.
A gear special rule. On a Perfect hit, the monster suffers an automatic wound. Limit once per attack.
An ability. When you roll on an investigate table, add +2 to your roll result.
An ability. Your Fist & Tooth has reach 2.
An ability. You may dash 1 additional time each round.
A monster is facing all spaces on the board that are in front of the miniature.
A monster reaction. Performed in response to unsuccessful wound attempts at certain monster hit locations.

The Fairy Ring is a special feature of the Flower Knight showdown. It is not terrain. The Fairy Ring is always placed in the center of the showdown board, ignoring any effects that say otherwise (e.g. Ambush rules). If a terrain card or other effect directs you to place a terrain tile inside the Fairy Ring during the showdown or showdown setup, do not place it. If a rule or effect directs you to move a terrain tile into the Fairy Ring during the showdown, it inexplicably stops short at its border.
Gear with this keyword is a fan weapon.
An ability. At the start of a showdown with the picked monster, gain +1 speed token.
A gear keyword. This gear is substantively crafted of feathers.
A maneuver. Spend {m}{q} to move your survivor 3 spaces away from the monster. Activate and attack with a bow or arrow in your gear grid. This attack gains +3 accuracy and +3 range.
An ability. During your act, consume and archive one of your attribute tokens to suffer bleed 1.
A survivor is in a monster's field of view unless they are in the monster's blind spot or the monster's line of sight is blocked by terrain with the Obstacle rule.

Powerful battle techniques found on fighting art cards. When a fighting art is gained, record its rules on the survivor record sheet and return the card to the box. Survivors can have up to 3 fighting arts. Additional fighting arts gained replace a fighting art of your choice. If a survivor would gain a fighting art they already have, nothing happens.
A gear keyword. This gear requires finesse to use.

A type of monster hit location. This hit location must be resolved before any others, except Traps. If multiple First Strike locations are drawn, the player decides the order in which to resolve them. Traps still precede and cancel all other hits.
A resource keyword. These resources can be acquired via the special hunt event Sky Fishing.

A survival action. Once per round, a standing survivor may spend 1 survival at any time to fist pump a knocked down survivor, letting them stand. Blind survivors cannot stand from fist pump. Survivors can only fist pump if the settlement has the Silent Dialect innovation.

Fist & Tooth is a weapon always available to a survivor. The attack attributes for First & Tooth are listed on the gear grid. Survivors may gain levels of Fist & Tooth weapon proficiency with this weapon.
The Faceism neurosis. You can only attack the monster from its facing or if it is knocked down.
A gear keyword. Fire can destroy this gear.
A space adjacent to the monster that is not in the monster's facing or blind spot.
An armor set effect. After you slam, spend {q} to move 1 space and attack with a melee weapon. If you are attacking with a dagger, increase the range of your Perfect hits by 2 for this attack.
A gear keyword. This gear is substantively crafted of flesh.
When a monster with a flinch token attempts to perform a reaction, cancel that reaction and discard this token. A monster cannot have more than one flinch token.
An ability. Gain +1 movement and +1 evasion. You cannot wear leg armor.
Flows are hesitations between monster actions. They give the survivors an opportunity to use survival actions. They are represented by a bar with an arrow.
A resource keyword. Flowers are perishable resources that can be harvested in specific areas.
A gear special rule. Spend {q}{m}, full move in a straight line, then activate a weapon and attack. This attack gains +1 accuracy for each space you moved.

Survivors have Foresight if there are any revealed {O} or {N} cards on top of decks. When a deck is shuffled, all cards are turned face down and no longer grant Foresight unless otherwise specified. Survivors can gain Foresight from certain gear or abilities. Certain monster effects, such as Duration and Repeat cards, will also grant survivors Foresight.
A survivor ability. Gain +2 evasion. Forgettable survivors cannot be encouraged.
An ability. On Arrival, gain +1 accuracy tokens equal to your permanent luck.
The direction the miniature is facing.
An ability. A permanent design with intricate line work too fine for the naked eye to see. Gain +1 to all rolls on the Arc Intimacy story event.
A gear keyword. This gear is easily broken.
A gear special rule. Frail weapons are destroyed if a survivor attempts to wound a Super-dense location with them. Archive the weapon at the end of the attack.
The Verminism neurosis. No matter how protected you are, you know your insides are vulnerable. +1 systemic pressure.

A brain trauma result. A survivor who suffers this is Frenzied until the end of the Showdown Phase. Gain +1 strength token, +1 speed token, and 1d5 insanity. Ignore the "slow" special rule on melee weapons. A frenzied survivor may not spend survival or use fighting arts, weapon specialization, or weapon mastery. A survivor may be Frenzied multiple times.
A gear special rule. This armor gear is worn at every hit location. You may not equip armor gear at any hit location while wearing a Full Ensemble.
A game term that describes a monster's or survivor's maximum available movement, taking into account all movement modifier tokens.
A gear keyword. This gear is substantively crafted of thick fur.
An ability. When you suffer a severe body injury, the monster suffers an automatic hit that inflicts a critical wound.

A special d10 used by the Gambler. A Gambler's Die has unique sides that differ from standard d10s. When instructed to roll a Gambler's Die, you may not roll another die in its place. Gambler's Dice do not have lantern 10s; instead there are Gambler icons on some die faces.
An ability. When you are the monster controller and the monster draws {O}, instead draw 2 cards and select 1 to perform, placing the other back on top of the {O} deck.

Objects that survivors may carry and wear, represented by gear cards. Survivors may only use the gear in their individual gear grids. Except for gear with the weapon keyword, no survivor may have more than one copy of a gear card in their grid.

A mat with space for 9 gear cards. Gear cards can be arranged in any configuration, but must remain right-side up. They cannot be rotated. Gear in gear grids can only be rearranged during the Settlement Phase.
Located directly under the name of a gear card,. They describe information about gear, such as weapon type, materials, use, or limiting factors. Keywords are referenced by other cards and events.
Found on the backs of Green Knight Armor. These recipes list the requirements needed to craft these rare and powerful gear cards.
Located on the bottom portion of a gear card. These list gear abilities, bonuses and requirements.
The Flower Knight's instinct. Described on the Flower Knight's showdown story event and basic action card.

The survivors may suddenly find themselves face-to-face with the King. When the King performs Ghost Geometry, place the monster adjacent to the target, on top of as many other survivors as possible. On collision, survivors suffer {l}+2 brain damage.
An ability. Gain +2 strength and +1 luck when attacking a 3x3 or larger monster. When you participate in Intimacy, newborns with your surname gain this ability in addition to any other benefits.
A gear keyword. This gear has an unnatural gloom to it.

The Godhand can respond to your attacks with impossible speed. When a hit location with Godspeed is selected, before making a wound attempt, if there are 2 or fewer hit locations to resolve (including this one), end all attacks and draw {O}.
A gear keyword. This gear is substantively crafted of gormskin.
Grab is an action performed by some monsters. To perform Grab, place target knocked down in front of the monster (in an unoccupied space). Target suffers 1 damage per monster level.
A gear special rule. This weapon gains +1 strength for each red affinity you have.
A gear special rule. Spend {m}{q} to gain +1 luck until the end of the round for every 2 blue affinities you have.
A gear special rule. When you depart, add {!} to all hit locations for every 2 green affinities you have.
Gear with this keyword is a grand weapon. Survivors may gain levels of grand weapon proficiency with this weapon.
An ability. Add +1 to your body severe injury roll results. Ignore monster Intimidate actions.
The Screaming Antelope's instinct. Described on the Screaming Antelope's showdown story event and basic action card.

A gear special rule. When you are attacking and Block a hit, you may move up to 6 consecutive spaces. If you do, your next wound attempt this attack gains strength equal to the number of spaces moved.
An ability. Once per lantern year, at any time, you may set your insanity to 0, 1, or 2.
The Lonely Tree's instinct. Described on the Lonely Tree's showdown story event and basic action card.
A gear special ability. At the end of your attack, if you are standing and have a shield in your gear grid, spend 1 survival to move 3 spaces directly away from the monster and Block 1 for free.
The King's Man's instinct. Described on the King's Man's showdown story event and basic action card.
A special rule. A survivor with guardless may not dodge, block, deflect, or ignore hits. Attack rolls can still miss guardless survivors, as they still factor their evasion in.

Survivors may become guilty during the Smog Singers showdown. A survivor is guilty if they have 3+ guilt tokens. The guiltiest survivor is the guilty survivor with the most guilt tokens (monster controller chooses in case of ties).
When a monster has suffered at least half the wounds in its {O} deck (rounded up) or its Life total is at half or lower of its starting value, it is considered half killed.
A gear special rule. When you hit with this, the monster gains a -1 attribute token of the specified type.

A type of {O} card. When a Harmony card is drawn, each monster performs it one at a time. The monster controller chooses the order in which the monsters perform the harmony. Persistent injuries happen only once, and the harmony continues for the other monsters. The instinct does not cancel the harmony.
A special survival action. After resolving the last hit location of an attack, spend 1 survival to strike the Smog Singer. The attacked monster suffers knockback 1. Then, you may pursue.
A survivor hit location. Damage to the head beyond the heavy injury box will prompt a roll on the Head section of the Severe Injury table.
An attack that always hits a survivor's head hit location. Do not roll hit location dice for this attack.
When survivors heal, erase all filled injury levels and restore all lost armor points.

When a monster performs heal X, return X AI cards from the Wound Stack to the bottom of the AI deck without looking at them. When a monster with the Life trait heals, if the monster's current Life is less than its starting value, increase the Life number by the indicated amount (up to the starting value).
The Storm constellation ability. If you gain weapon proficiency during the Aftermath, gain an additional 3 levels. You cough up a hunk of your own solidified blood and gain 1 Iron strange resource.
An ability. You cannot be the straggler. On Arrival, choose a board edge. You may move up to three additional spaces toward your chosen board edge after a {m} action.
A gear keyword. This gear has substantial weight.
A heavy lined injury level box. When a survivor's heavy injury level is filled, they are knocked down. Once it is filled, this injury level cannot be suffered again this showdown unless it is healed.
A wanderer ability. At the start of your act, you may spend 6 survival to give melee weapons in your gear grid Cumbersome and Devastating 1 until the end of your act.
An ability. It takes an additional bleeding token to kill you. This ability can be gained multiple times.
A resource and gear keyword. This item is an herb.
A story event that may be placed as a Special Hunt Event card on the Hunt Board when a survivor has a sickle.
A gear special rule. During your attack roll with this weapon, reroll any natural 1s. You must keep the new results.
A common resource keyword.
Used to determine the survivor hit location hit by an attack.

Each monster has a unique hit location deck composed of hit location cards. There are 5 types of hit location card: First Strike, Impervious, Super-dense, Trap, and Normal. Any hit location that has no listed type is Normal.

Hit locations are areas of the survivors' body that can wear armor and suffer damage. The hit locations are: Head, Arms, Body, Waist, and Legs. Hit locations may gain armor points from armor. Without armor, hit locations have 0 armor points.

A hit is the result of an attack roll that meets or exceeds the accuracy for an attack using an attack profile. Hits which are dodged, blocked, or ignored are misses. Damage outside of an attack profile is not considered to be from a hit.
A maneuver. Spend {m}{q} to full move forward and attack. If you moved at least 4 spaces, the first time you wound during this attack, encourage all survivors.
A hit is the result of an attack roll that meets or exceeds the accuracy for an attack using a weapon.
A survivor ability. Add +5 to your rolls on the Run Away story event.

A gear special rule. This gear has +X strength. After successfully wounding a Super-Dense or Parry hit location, the edge is ruined and the weapon loses its bonus strength. Some effects allow you regain Hone benefits. When the survivors return to the settlement, all Honed gear is mended, regaining its lost strength.
The Hunt Board is used during the Hunt Phase to track a quarry monster.
Part of a monster's showdown story event. It indicates how to set up the hunt board for that monster.
A hunt event describes an encounter the survivors face on their journey. They can be disastrous, bizarre, or even beneficial. These appear on basic hunt event cards and monster hunt event cards.
Monster hunt event cards are only encountered when hunting a particular monster. They describe pitfalls and wonders specific to this monster. Each quarry monster has a unique set of hunt event cards.
All basic hunt event cards are identical. They direct the event revealer to roll on the hunt event table.

Survivors gain Hunt Experience during the Aftermath of a victorious showdown. When a survivor gains Hunt XP, fill in the next unfilled Hunt XP box on their survivor record sheet. Some hunt experience levels are milestones (indicated by a heavy-lined box) that trigger the Age story event. The number of milestones filled indicates which Age rules apply. When the final hunt experience box is filled, the survivor is too old to hunt, and must retire.
The part of each session spent locating a quarry monster. When survivors determine what type and level of monster to hunt.
Hushed survivors are cloaked in silence. They ignore vibration damage, are considered deaf, and cannot encourage, roar, scream, perform audible effects, or activate noisy gear.

A survivor wearing all armor listed on a hybrid armor set will have completed the set and gains the benefits of the corresponding armor set card if the settlement has acquired it. When a survivor departs with a hybrid armor set bonus, set their armor points at all hit locations to the number of armor points printed on the hybrid armor set card (before adding modifiers). Losing an armor set bonus during the hunt or showdown does not change armor points at any hit locations. Multiple survivors may gain the same hybrid armor set bonus despite there being only one copy of the hybrid armor set card.
An ability. During your act, you may gain a bleeding token to perform Block 1 at no cost. Limit once per round.
To ignore a hit, reduce the number of hits by 1. This happens before hit locations are determined.
Reduce the number of hits by 1. This happens before hit locations are determined.
The Gorm's instinct. Described on the Gorm's showdown story event and basic action card.
A maneuver. Spend {m}{q} to move 3 spaces forward. If you do, activate a melee weapon with +1 strength for each of your bleeding tokens.
A showdown special rule. When a survivor is knocked down, or after a survivor suffers knockback, the sound of their impact is converted to force. They suffer 3 damage to a random hit location.
Permanent changes or injuries suffered by a survivor and recorded on the survivor record sheet. These often result from the severe injury table.

A terrain special rule. A survivor cannot voluntarily move into or through any spaces this terrain occupies. Impassable terrain stops all movement, including knockback. If a survivor is knocked back into a space occupied by impassable terrain, they collide with the terrain and their movement ends just before the terrain.
The Manhunter's instinct. Described on the Manhunter's showdown story event and basic action card.
A gear special rule. During your wound attempt with this weapon, reroll any natural 1s. You must keep the new results.
A type of monster hit location. Impervious hit locations cannot be wounded, even with a Lantern 10 wound roll. Wound attempts will never remove AI cards. However, critical effects may still occur.

The Optimism neurosis. When you depart, if your total number of armor points (after all bonuses) is the highest among all departing survivors armor point totals, you are filled with confidence. Gain survival up to the settlement's survival limit. Otherwise, lose all survival.
An ability. When you suffer a severe injury, gain +1 luck token.

During the Showdown, a survivor is in darkness if something is casting a shadow and they are in that shadow. (Traditionally, this only occurs with a Sunspot Lantern or during the Sunstalker showdown.) Some cards care about survivors being in darkness.
A terrain special rule. This terrain cannot be destroyed or removed from the showdown board for any reason until the end of the showdown.

Indomitable resources are often earned by defeating Level 3+ quarry monsters. Many indomitable resources can be used to craft special pattern gear cards. These resources are the only way to obtain their respective patterns.
An ability. When you gain this, choose a weapon. It gains Sharp. Record this on your survivor record sheet. Erase it when the gear is archived.
The Regalism neurosis. You may not depart if you have the highest strength among all survivors.
Indicates damage to a hit location. Recorded on the survivor record sheet. Most hit locations feature two levels, light and heavy, except for the Head (which only has a heavy injury level).

An endeavor action that survivors can take. Spend one endeavor, one bone, one hide, and one organ resource each to draw from your Innovation deck to see what your settlement innovates. This action is limited to once per lantern year.
A type of advancement for a settlement, gained at the Lantern Hoard. Innovations alter the settlement and the survivors' capabilities. Record new innovations on your settlement record sheet.

When a settlement gains an innovation, they may find themselves adding its consequences to their innovation deck (a persistently evolving deck). Find all appropriate cards in your game box that have the correct consequence and shuffle them into your innovation deck.
A settlement's innovation deck is a persistent deck that grows as the settlement innovates.

All cards are considered in play after they have been drawn and until they resolve. Most cards are discarded after resolving. Others, such as Moods, remain in play indefinitely or until a condition is satisfied.

A survivor is in a monster's range if the number of spaces between them is less than or equal to its current movement (including modifiers). If "in range" is followed by a number, such as range (8), that number replaces the monster's movement when calculating to see if a survivor is in range.
A survivor with 3+ insanity.
Protects a survivor from brain damage.
The action the monster undertakes if it cannot find a target to attack. Each monster has a unique instinct described on its showdown story event.
A gear keyword. This gear can be used to play music.

A gear special rule.. Spend {q} to attack with an instrument in your gear grid. All survivors within 5 spaces, including you, suffer 3 damage to 3 random hit locations. Then, all monsters within 5 spaces of you are automatically hit 3 times. Each wound attempt for this attack gains +4d10 strength.
A survivor is insulated if they have 6 or more gear cards that grant them armor points.
A survivor ability. You ignore the monster's accuracy tokens and always treat your evasion as 0. Your gear loses the noisy keyword while it is in your gear grid.

Intimidate actions cause brain damage. Intimidate actions are not attacks or hits (survivors cannot spend survival to dodge Intimidate actions). Monsters don't need to be adjacent to their targets to intimidate.
A survivor ability. When you depart, add {1} to each hit location for each different-colored affinity in your gear grid.
An ability. You cannot be knocked down. Reduce all knockback you suffer to knockback 1.
An impairment. Unseen illness. During the Update Timeline step, before settlement events are drawn, roll 1d10. On a 5 or less, you succumb to radiation poisoning. Dead.
A gear special rule. If a survivor dies or ceases to exist, archive all irreplaceable gear in their gear grids.
A survivor is isolated if they are not adjacent to any other survivors.
A gear keyword. Gear that is neither a weapon nor armor.
A gear keyword. Decorative and functional!
An impairment. You cannot surge.
A head severe injury replacement. Your neck is expertly cut, even through layers of clothing and armor. Gain {l} bleeding tokens.

An ability. Once per hunt phase, when you are the event revealer, you may take a detour to search for a nest of lantern bugs. Roll a random hunt event. Afterwards, you return with bug juice and all survivors gain +1d5 survival.
Gear with this keyword is a katana weapon. Survivors may gain levels of Katana weapons proficiency with this weapon only if they have certain expansions.
Gear with this keyword is a katar weapon. Survivors may gain levels of katar weapon proficiency with this weapon.
Keen attacks ignore positive evasion modifiers.
A gear special rule. When you have any tokens and you attack, gain +4 strength for the attack. Discard all your tokens when the attack ends.
A gear keyword. These gear have knightly qualities to them, bestowing tactical prowess upon their wearer.
Spend {M}{A}, full move in a straight line. At the end of the movement, activate Griswaldo and attack. If you moved more than 5 spaces, this attack gains devastating 2.
Move the target of knockback x spaces directly away from the cause of this effect.

While a monster is knocked down, attack rolls hit on 3+ (in place of normal accuracy). Cancel all reactions, including reactions that might be beneficial to survivors. This does not cancel critical wounds effects (since they are not reactions). If the monster is knocked down by a survivor during an {O}, cancel any remaining actions on its card. A knocked down monster stands when: it draws an AI card, a trap is played, or at the start of the next turn (monster or survivors').

When a survivor is knocked down, turn the miniature on its side. Knocked down survivors always stand at the end of the next monster turn. If a survivor is knocked down in the middle of their attack, the remainder of that attack is canceled. Knocked down survivors may only spend survival to dodge (remaining knocked down), and cannot spend activation or movement.
A gear keyword. A lantern illuminates the darkness.
A die roll result with the lantern face up. Equivalent to a 10 for other 10-sided die.

A special type of proficiency. When a survivor is wearing a full Lantern Armor set, they may select Lantern Armor as their weapon proficiency type instead of a weapon. During the Aftermath, they are eligible to gain a proficiency rank if they suffered damage during the showdown. In order to claim the benefits of Specialization and/or Mastery, the survivor must be wearing a full Lantern Armor set and claim its armor set bonus card.

A story event. Survivors can improve their Lantern Research Level during the settlement phase and expand the range of Pulse Discoveries available to them, allowing them to access further powers with the Death Die.
Survivors' basic unit of time. The settlement typically advances by one lantern year as part of each Settlement Phase.
An impairment. When you gain a token, suffer 1 damage to a random hit location.
An ability. During your act, if you are Honorable, you may give an adjacent survivor one of your survival. Limit once per round.
The survivor who last wounded the monster.

A gear special rule. Spend {M}{A} to leap into the air! Place your survivor on an unoccupied space exactly 5 spaces away in a straight line, then activate a melee weapon with +2 accuracy and +5 strength.
A special survival action. When the Frogdog Leaps, spend 1 survival to attract it so it lands on the Mammoth Leaf closest to you.
A gear keyword. Cured hides are a crucial component of this gear.
An ability. Once a lifetime, on a hunt board space after Overwhelming Darkness, in place of rolling a random hunt event, use "53" as your result.
A survivor hit location. Damage to the legs beyond the heavy injury box will prompt a roll on the Legs section of the Severe Injury table.
When you gain the Death Die, you stand. While you have the Death Die, you can not be knocked down for any reason.
A survivor impairment. Reduce all damage suffered by 1 to a minimum of 1. Suffer -2 to severe injury rolls.
An ability. At the end of your attack with a weapon with the metal keyword, if you hit the monster, it is shocked and suffers an automatic wound.
An ability. While there is no armor or accessory gear in your gear grid, gain +3 evasion.
An ability. In the Aftermath, gain 1 additional Hunt XP. You may not wear other gear. If you trigger the White Secret story event, you cease to exist. When you retire, you cease to exist.
A core game variant. Instead wounding by removing AI cards to the wound stack, wound the monster by reducing the number on its Life trait. When the number is reduced to 0, the monster is dead.

A type of monster hit location. Light Speed hit locations are faster than First Strike hit locations. An attacker must select Light Speed hit locations before First Strike hit locations and before any other type of hit location cards. If multiple Light Speed hit locations are drawn in an attack, the attacker chooses which one to resolve first.

Atlas may suddenly yearn for something forgotten. To perform a limbic stimulation, shuffle the wound stack, then reveal cards from the top until you reveal a mood card and put it into play. If no moods are revealed, nothing happens.

The Sculptor constellation ability. Once per settlement phase, spend 2 {E} to carve a prosthetic limb. Remove a survivor's dismembered severe injury and add 1 Bone basic resource to the settlement storage.

This can only happen once to a survivor. If it occurs again, nothing happens. In rare cases, it is possible for a survivor to be part of a new campaign; the survivor still has only one lifetime and anything that already happened to them (with limit, once per lifetime) cannot happen again. If a survivor somehow dies and is reborn, they may gain these benefits again. Record once per lifetime effects on the survivor record sheet.
An impairment. Add a filmy light injury level box to each hit location. You cannot erase your light injury level boxes for any reason.

A gear special rule. This gear must be loaded before it can be used. Spend {q} to place a prep token on this gear if it does not already have one. Survivors must spend both an activation and a prep token on this gear to attack with it.
A gear special rule. This gear cannot be disarmed.
A wanderer ability. You may dash 1 additional time per round. You cannot perform any survival action except for dash. At the start of your act, gain survival up to the settlement limit.

A survivor ability. Before making a wound attempt, you may declare "Lucernae X" in a loud, booming voice. If you do, that wound attempt gains +X luck. X cannot be more than your total blue affinities. When the attack ends, gain +X Hunt XP.

Every positive monster luck token reduces the range of wound roll results considered critical. Normally, critical wounds occur only on Lantern tens. Unless survivors have positive luck modifiers, a critical wound against a monster with 1 or more luck tokens is impossible. Each negative monster luck token increases the attackers' critical wound range by 1. The rule of Lantern 10 always applies, so even if a monster's luck makes critically wounding impossible, a wound roll of a Lantern 10 will still cause a normal wound.

Luck modifies a survivor's chance to cause a critical wound from a wound roll. +1 luck causes a critical wound on a wound roll result of 9 or 10, +2 luck on 8, 9, or 10, and so on. A luck modifier can be negative, making it impossible to critically wound.

An arc survivor attribute. Lumi can be spent to acquire knowledge at the Forum settlement location and to perform various feats. Lumi does not automatically replenish. When an effects instructs you to spend lumi, reduce the lumi value on your arc survivor record sheet by the designated amount.
An ability. Once per showdown, as a monster draws an AI, name a card. If the AI card drawn is the named card, gain +1 evasion token.
A Bone Eaters effect. Survivors who accept a Majestic Invitation are never seen again.

Some effects let players manipulate a deck of cards. This may involve revealing cards, discarding cards, or changing their positions in the deck. Wounding a monster and moving a card to the wound stack does not manipulate the deck, nor does drawing {N} to resolve from a successful attack. Face up Duration and Repeat cards ignore effects that manipulate the {O} card.
An ability. When you craft a Seed Pattern, gain +1 permanent strength and +1 Hunt XP. At 10+ Hunt XP, you leave the settlement.
An impairment. If the Murder or Skull Eater settlement events are drawn, nominate this survivor.
A gear keyword. An accessory worn on the head.
An ability. When you are a returning survivor, once per lantern year, you may spend {t} to {s} Intimacy.
Remove the monster from the showdown board and place it adjacent to the target. It must be placed so its base covers as many other survivors as possible, colliding with the survivors.

A gear special rule. When you depart, consume this (do not archive) to gain its benefits. You can depart with only one meal. If a meal has a monster name, it is a unique meal from that monster gained via Supreme Cuisine.
A weapon gear keyword. To attack with a melee weapon, survivors must be in a space adjacent to the monster. Melee weapons with Reach can attack from further away.
A gear special rule. On Arrival, place X +1 strength tokens on this gear. At the end of your act, remove a +1 strength token from this gear.
The Butcher's instinct. Described on the Butcher's showdown story event and basic action card.
Restore injury levels and lost armor points up to the amount specified by X. Injury levels must be restored at a location before lost armor points.
An ability. During the settlement phase, spend {v} to nominate a survivor with less Hunt XP than you. They gain +2 lumi and +2 Hunt XP. Limit once per lantern year.

An ability and a pulse discovery. Any time during the showdown, you may roll the Death Die. Gain twice that much survival. This round, ignore negative effects of permanent injuries, impairments, disorders, and negative attributes (including tokens). At the end of the round, you die.
A gear keyword. This gear is substantively crafted of metal.
An ability. Your Fist & Tooth attacks gain Sharp (add 1d10 strength to each wound attempt).

A gear special rule. When you Mindlock X, gain (or lose) mindlock tokens until you have X of them. When you suffer brain damage, if you have any mindlock tokens, you ignore it and lose a mindlock token.
A story event that may be placed as a Special Hunt Event card on the Hunt Board when a survivor has a pickaxe. Every survivor with a pickaxe rolls on the Mineral Gathering table.
A gear keyword. This gear has substantial amounts of minerals in its structure, making it a prime choice for Calcification.
The physical representation of a monster or survivor, used in the Hunt and Showdown phases.

Minions are small monsters that appear in expansions. They often have their own Minion Actions, toughness, and unique attributes that are described on cards or in their rulebooks. Refer to the appropriate expansion rules for all details regarding the minions present in that expansion.
Each monster has a unique AI deck. Its showdown story event describes how to construct a Monster AI Deck at the appropriate level.

The player who draws the monster's AI card. They make any decisions and rolls to resolve a monster's actions for that round. Designated by the Monster Controller tile. Monster controller changes at the start of each round.
When a monster controller's survivor becomes the target (or one of the targets) from a Pick Target list on an AI card, this foolhardy action earns that player's survivor +1 insanity.
Designates the monster controller. Moves clockwise to the next player or survivor at the start of each round.

A special terrain present in the Lonely Tree expansion (represented by the fruit miniatures). When a monster has Monster Fruit in play, perform the actions listed on Monster Fruit before any other actions during the monster turn. Proceed through the rest of the monster turn normally.
Represents a location on the monster's body. These are hit by a survivor's successful attack roll. Many hit location cards feature special effects or actions.
The cards that collectively make up the locations a survivor may hit a given monster. Unique to each monster.

A terrain special rule. Monster-Impassable terrain has all of the characteristics of impassable terrain, but with the following addition: Monsters may not move through spaces occupied by monster-impassable terrain. Monsters must move around monster-impassable terrain tiles, if possible. If this is not possible (such as when the monster is instructed to move in a straight line), they instead end their movement in the space before the terrain tile.
Monster level determines the difficulty of the showdown and the monster's placement on the hunt board. Higher-level monsters have longer hunts and more difficult showdowns.
Contains a small overview of each monster's characteristics. They serve as a compact reminder of frequently-used monster information.

Monster resource cards are gained only from fighting that monster. Each huntable monster has a unique deck. Monster resources can be used and spent as their resource type or as their specific resource name. Some monster resources have additional rules.

Contains relevant information for a particular monster's showdown and hunt, including instructions on constructing a monster AI deck, hunt and showdown board setup, the monster's instinct and basic attack, and information on the aftermath of the showdown.

A type of monster AI card. Once mood cards are drawn, leave them in the play area instead of discarding them at the end of the monster turn. Moods can be removed by some items or through conditions listed on the card. If a monster suffers a wound when it has an empty AI deck and discard pile but one or more active moods, it is defeated.
The survivor with the most/least of the listed condition. Zero can count as most or least unless otherwise stated.
The Lion God's instinct. Described on the Lion God's showdown story event and basic action card.
A component of most AI cards. A Move and Attack Target Action follows a Pick Target Action. Full move the monster towards the target and perform the following attack profile.

Some monsters use Move into Range and Attack actions. When the monster is instructed to do so, end the monster's movement the specified number of spaces away from the target based on the Range. If the monster is closer to the target than the Range, move it until it is exactly in Range.
The maximum amount of spaces a monster or survivor may move with in single move action. A monster or survivor with less than 1 movement may still move 1 space each move action.
When a monster is instructed to move through a target, it moves towards the target but instead of stopping when adjacent, its movement continues. This will normally cause collision with the target.

The Homicidalism neurosis. During the hunt or showdown, if you are ever alone with another survivor, you murder them. Keep track of your Body Count on your record sheet. Before resolving each rank of Homicidalism, roll 1d10 and subtract your Body Count from the roll result. On a 1 or lower, the settlement kills you.
A survivor ability. Gain +2 accuracy. You may only attack with daggers and katars.

A secret fighting art from the Lion God expansion. Necromancers gain a bonus on the Death Reading story event and from the event's rare gear. Necromancers roll on the Worm Trauma table instead of the severe injury table (for random severe injuries). If the Necromancer dies or loses the secret fighting art, the resilient worm returns to the settlement and they regain the Knowledge Worm innovation. This happens regardless of whether or not the Necromancer is hamstrung, frenzied, or otherwise unable to use fighting arts.
Nemesis monsters show up at the outskirts of the settlement. They cannot be hunted, and will arrive during story events.
A compulsion unique to arc survivors. When they adopt a philosophy, they gain a neurosis, an unfavorable outcome of their beliefs that modifies their behavior throughout their life.

Some effects persist until the next monster turn. If it is the survivors' turn, the effect will end on the monster turn immediately following this turn. If it is the monster's turn when this effect begins, it will end on the following monster turn.
