Some effects persist until the end of the next complete round. These effects will end after the monster, then the survivors, take another turn.
A survivor ability. Whenever you gain a bleeding token, add {1} to all hit locations.
A survivor ability. You may spend {A}{M} to exchange any 1 of your tokens for a +1 strength token.
A survivor ability. Once per showdown, you may spend all your survival (at least 1) to lose all your +1 strength tokens and gain that many +1 luck tokens.

A resource requirement. Node-specific resources must be obtained from showdowns with monsters of the listed node. See the Campaigns, Nodes, and Pillars section of the rulebook for more information (page 56).
A gear keyword. This gear is hard to keep quiet.
Survivors not suffering from the deaf severe head injury.
A showdown board marker. The North Star is not a terrain tile. It denotes which direction is North during the Atnas nemesis showdown.

The last option on a monster's Pick Target list. It indicates what to do if no target is found. This is most often a monster's Instinct action. When a monster cannot find a target, subsequent actions on the card are not performed.

Novel weapon proficiency types may not normally be selected to accumulate weapon proficiency levels. Only remarkable circumstances inspire survivors to train with these weapons. When survivors gain a novel weapon proficiency, they may select this weapon type and accumulate weapon proficiency ranks as normal. Mastering novel weapon types does not confer any benefits to other survivors in the settlement.
A novice is a survivor with 1 or less Hunt XP.
A gear keyword. This gear is crafted from a nuclear core, radiating with power.

An ability. You are resistant to radiation. When you roll 1d10 due to the Irradiated impairment, add +3 to the roll result. If this causes your roll result to become 11+, gain +1 permanent strength. When you participate in Intimacy, newborns gain Nullifying Antibody in addition to any other benefits.
A survival action. Once per round, if you do not have a shattered jaw, spend 1 survival to recite the forbidden words to another survivor and remove one of their tokens.

A hunt event unique to the Lonely Tree expansion. It has a basic hunt event card back. It is shuffled into the basic hunt event cards, and can be randomly drawn from any hunt board space. The event is archived after it is resolved -- it is permanently removed from the basic hunt events and returned to the game box.

The accumulated examination of a survivor's thoughts as they process knowledge. Many knowledge cards have unique observation conditions, as well as a maximum number of observations that must be reached before advancing to a new rank, receiving a new knowledge, or suffering a negative effect. If the opportunity to make an observation is missed, that observation is lost and should not be performed/recorded. Dangerous observations, however, must be performed/recorded even if they are forgotten during gameplay. Some knowledge cards have no observations.

A terrain rule. This terrain blocks survivor and monster field of view, interrupting ranged weapon attacks and monster targeting. To check if field of view is blocked, draw an imaginary line from the center for the miniature's base to the center of the intended target's base. If the line comes in contact with a space occupied by an obstacle, the field of view is blocked and the target is not in field of view.

At the start of your act, you may declare "Olthawartta X" in a loud, booming voice. If you do, ignore the effects of X special rules until the end of your act among the following: Cumbersome, Early Iron, Frail, Sentient, Slow, Unwieldy. X cannot be greater than your total pairs of red and blue affinities. When your act ends, gain +X Hunt XP. When you trigger your 2nd Hunt XP milestone, gain the Heart of Olthawartta secret fighting art.

"On collision" is shorthand for when a monster, survivor, or terrain tile collides with something else. Cards that read "on collision" have special rules describing what happens when two things collide. Refer to the Kingdom Death: Monster core game for full collision rules.
An ability. When you die, do not gain the benefits of your Death principle. Two survivors emerge from your corpse. Refer to the Pariah rulebook for rules describing your division.
A gear special rule. If all your attack rolls hit, double your wound attempt totals for the attack.
An encounter monster deck. Encounter monsters will draw opportunity cards from this deck when certain conditions are met.
A survivor ability. At the start of the showdown, look through the AI deck, then shuffle it.
A common resource keyword.
A gear keyword. The effects of this gear are otherworldly. Saviors may never have Other gear in their gear grids.

This completes an armor set if you're wearing the rest of the set and it shares a material keyword with the missing armor gear. For example, if you're wearing an Oxidized Lantern Helm and Phoenix Armor on every other hit location, you would gain the Phoenix Armor set bonus because the Phoenix Helm also has the metal keyword.
An ability. When you are the scout, you may add +2 to any roll result during a hunt event. Limit once per hunt phase.
An impairment. When you suffer a random brain trauma, roll twice and pick the lowest result. When you are a returning survivor, gain +2 {v}.

A unique survival action in People of the Sun. If you have any +1 strength tokens, you may spend 1 survival and remove them all to give your next attack this round devastating 1. Limit once per round.

A space on the Hunt Board. The first time each hunt the survivors move into the Overwhelming Darkness space, they trigger the Overwhelming Darkness story event. The survivors cannot skip Overwhelming Darkness. If they move through the space, instead stop all movement and resolve Overwhelming Darkness before any other events or effects. Then, resolve other events or effects on this space. If, for some reason, the survivors move into or through Overwhelming Darkness more than once in a single Hunt Phase, treat it as a blank space. If the monster is on the Overwhelming Darkness space when the survivors move into it, skip its event and start the showdown immediately.

A gear special rule. Paired weapons are two weapons that are used as one. Add the speed of the second weapon when attacking with the first. These weapons must have the same name, and both must be in your gear grid.

A type of hit location. This hit location represents the monster skillfully deflecting an attack. When attempting to wound Parry hit locations, all wound attempts fail unless the wound roll result is critical. This failure triggers any Failure and Reflex reactions as normal.

An ability. When you both Arrive, gain survival up to the survival limit. Partners may only nominate each other for Intimacy. When a partner dies, the remaining partner gains a random disorder and loses this ability.

A special invention born from the minds of insightful survivors. Patterns can be used to craft unusual and powerful gear cards that cannot be obtained otherwise. Patterns can be obtained from indomitable resources, the seed pattern deck, and general gameplay. Once obtained, patterns instruct players on how to craft the associated gear and which resources are needed. Seed Patterns may have additional requirements.

Pattern cards represent the ingenuity of survivors. You can craft gear from Pattern cards during the Develop step of the settlement phase. Spend the resources in the crafting recipe and ensure that all requirements of the crafting process are present, then gain the gear.
An ability. When you gain insanity, you may also gain an equal amount of survival.
A terrain special rule. Only include this in your terrain deck if playing a People of the Sun campaign.
An attack dice roll result of a Lantern 10. This always results in a hit. When there are multiple Perfect hits in a single attack, trigger any rules applying to Perfect hits that many times.
A gear special rule. Increase the range of your Perfect hits by X while attacking with this gear.
An ability. Potent filtration. At the end of your act, remove one of your negative attribute tokens. When you suffer the bleeding kidneys severe injury, lose this ability.
A resource keyword. Certain gear requires perfect resources to craft.
A resource rule. This cannot be added to settlement storage. At the end of the settlement phase, it is lost. Archive it.
An injury to a survivor that does not heal with time. Its effects always apply to that survivor unless canceled by another effect.
A gear special rule. On a Perfect hit, gain +X survival.

A special injury found on some hit location cards. When a monster suffers a critical wound on a hit location with a persistent injury, leave the card in play instead of discarding it. Some persistent injuries modify a monster's behavior, while others affect specific AI cards.

Found on some AI cards. Persistent injury actions are conditional actions that replace the normal rules of an AI card. They are only performed when the monster draws an AI card with a persistent injury action that matches a persistent injury in play. If a persistent injury action is performed, ignore other actions on the card.

An accumulation of an arc survivor's guiding principles. Philosophy books replace the Age story event for arc survivors and have numerous impacts on their abilities, attributes, and individual narratives.

The source of philosophies for a settlement. When a survivor adopts a philosophy, draw a card from the philosophy deck and record the tenet knowledge, neurosis, Hunt XP milestones, and other effects. Some events and CC milestone cards will add new philosophies to the deck.
The Lanternism neurosis. You are bound by the light. While there is a Fallen Lantern terrain tile on the showdown board, you cannot spend survival.
A gear keyword. In certain situations, this can be used to mine minerals.

A component of most AI cards. A Pick Target list has a series of conditions. The monster controller checks to see if each targeting condition is met, starting from the first and stopping when one is et. Sometimes targets are determined by an area or zone (such as adjacent survivors or all survivors in a zone). Some AI cards pick more than one target.
Change the location of a miniature from one space on the showdown board to another. This does not count as movement.
A gear special rule. While you are attacking, you cannot be knocked down.

The act of progressing through a philosophy. When an arc survivor returns to the settlement after reaching a designated Hunt XP milestone, they ponder and advance to the next rank of their philosophy during the Check Milestones steps of the settlement phase. A survivor can ponder only once per settlement phase.
An impairment. The survivor cannot use weapon specialization, weapon mastery, or fighting arts.
A gear special rule. Spend {m} and {q} to move 3 spaces forward in a straight line and activate a melee weapon. This attack gains +1 strength.
A gear special rule. On a Perfect hit, inflict an automatic critical wound to the first X hit locations you resolve.
An ability. When rolling to determine a straggler, add your Hunt XP to your roll result.

The Witch constellation ability. Each time you attack, before drawing hit locations, loudly say a name. You lightly bite the eye in your cheek to see what it sees. If you draw any hit locations with that name, gain +3 insanity and +10 strength when attempting to wound them.
Survivors may find themselves in a predicament requiring a dangerous choice. Spend all your survival (at least 1) to prevail, or suffer the listed consequences.

Principles are your settlement's guiding philosophies. When a principle's story event triggers, your settlement must make a choice. Record the chosen principle on the settlement record sheet and add that principle's card to the settlement play area.

When a survivor gains the priority target token, they have captured the monster's attention. Only one survivor may have the priority target token at a time. Whenever a monster performs a Pick Target action, the survivor with the priority target token will always be picked. The priority target token is removed when the survivor with the token is picked, another survivor gains the priority target token, or an effect causes the priority target token to be removed.
An ability. Your complete affinities and incomplete affinity halves count as all colors.
A survivor ability. When you suffer a dismembered severe injury, ignore it and gain a bleeding token instead.
The Ambitionism tenet. Your tenet knowledge will be determined by the Rank 1 result in the Ambitionism booklet.

A survivor is proficient with the weapon they have declared and listed on their survivor record sheet next to their proficiency attribute. They are also proficient with the weapon if they have its Specialization or Mastery.

A gear special rule. Spend {q}{m}. Spend all armor points at a hit location. Suffer knockback in any direction equal to spent armor points, then activate a weapon and attack. Your attack gains this amount of strength.
A gear special rule. When you wound with this weapon, gain the priority target token.
There are 8 proxy cards. These can be used to replace lost cards or create game variants.

The Reaper constellation ability. Once per showdown, you may eat an adjacent survivor's disorder. If you do, remove the disorder. They gain 1 bleeding token and you gain +1 permanent strength. At the end of the showdown, if you haven't eaten a disorder, you die.
An ability. When you depart, add {!} to all hit locations for each of your Hunt XP milestones. When you suffer a severe injury, you also suffer a random brain trauma.
A series of abilities that can be unlocked via Lantern Research. A Pulse Discovery can be performed by a survivor with the Death Die.
A status survivors can have. Some cards and story events care if a survivor is Purified.
An effect that allows a survivor to give chase during an attack. Gain {m}, which must be spent immediately to move towards the monster. If you are now adjacent, draw another hit location.
A gear special rule. Puzzle affinity bonuses can only be gained if the affinities are completed using the affinities on that specific gear card (indicated by puzzle pieces instead of boxes).
The monster that the survivors have elected to hunt.
An ability. When you are a returning survivor, gain +2 lumi.
Determine using the included hit location dice.
Roll d100 and apply the hunt event corresponding to this number on the Hunt Event table.
The monster controller or event revealer typically determines a survivor by chance, using an equal probability of all possible outcomes.
A gear keyword. A ranged weapon, like a bow or dart, allows survivors to attack from a distance.

Some monsters can attack their targets at range. Refer to the monster's cards and rulebook to determine its range. Traditionally, the Range of a monster's attack will be stated on the card, but some monsters can attack with unlimited range.

A gear special rule. Survivors this many or fewer spaces away from a monster may attack with this weapon. Ranged weapons cannot be used if field of view to the monster is blocked (by terrain with the Obstacle rule).

The Gourmandism neurosis. You may spend {q} to consume a piece of gear or resource with the consumable keyword and archive it. During the Aftermath, if you did not do this at least once this lantern year, suffer -1 permanent strength.
A gear keyword. This gear is crafted of uncured hides.

A gear special rule. When attacking with a Razor Sharp weapon, roll the Razor Sharp die and add the result (denoted by the number of pips) to your wound attempt. This is not a wound roll and cannot cause critical wounds.
A special d6 included with certain game contents. The razor sharp die has different value than standard d6s. You can determine the result of a face by counting the number of pips showing.
A gear special rule. Reach weapons are long enough to attack monsters when the survivor is not adjacent. Reach specifies the maximum number of spaces away that a survivor can attack with this weapon.

A hit location rule. The 3 types of reactions are Wound, Failure, and Reflex. Each specifies the conditions for a reaction to occur. Reactions occur after rolling to wound the hit location they are found on and before resolving the next hit location.
An instruction on certain cards, such as disorders and fighting arts. Make a note of the listed effects and return the card to the game box.
An ability. When you draw a trap, cancel it, discard it, then reshuffle the hit location discard into the hit location deck and draw a new card. Limit once per lifetime.
A gear special rule. When this fails to wound, you may reroll the wound attempt. Limit once per attack.

A survivor ability. Your complete affinities and incomplete affinity halves count as all colors. You may dodge at any time and as many times as you like each round. When you attack from a blind spot, add +1d10 to all wound attempts for that attack.
An ability. Ignore Cumbersome on bows in your gear grid and reduce their range by 2.
A type of monster reaction. This reaction occurs regardless of whether a wound attempt succeeds or fails.
A survivor ability. Your complete affinities and incomplete affinity halves count as all colors. During the Showdown, after you perform a survival action, gain +1 survival.
A type of monster AI Card. At the end of a Relentless card, if there are any threats in the monster's field of view, reveal the next AI card. If it is relentless, play it.

Remove the monster miniature from the showdown board. Some cards will direct you to remove the monster from the showdown board. Set it aside and only place it back on the board when instructed to. Survivors cannot attack a monster while it is removed from the showdown board. Monsters still draw AI cards while removed from the showdown board, unless otherwise stated.

Remove the survivor miniature from the showdown board. Place it on its survivor status card, if it has one. A survivor removed from the showdown board has an Act, but may not spend movement, activation, or perform survival actions. Unless stated otherwise, they do not affect and are not affected by anything on the showdown board. When the showdown ends, any survivors who are removed from the board (but not dead) continue to the Aftermath as normal.

A type of {O}. When this card is resolved, place it back on top of the {O} deck face up. While it is face up, ignore effects that manipulate the {O} deck. Some Repeat cards may place tokens on themselves to track escalating variables.
An ability. When another survivor rolls a natural 1, you gain a reroll token. Limit once per round.

Some effects allow survivors to reroll a die result. They must spend the token or mark off their lifetime reroll box and reroll a single die from an action. The new result must be kept. Survivors may only use their reroll when they are affected by an action with a die roll.
A card is resolved when there are no more instructions to follow on it. This may be due to performing every indicated action, or as a result of specific instructions on the card.
Resource cards are gained from defeating monsters and from events. They are spent to develop the settlement and craft gear. In the core game, there are 4 kinds: Basic, Monster, Strange, and Vermin.
In addition to the specific name listed, all resource cards have one or more types that the card may be used as. Common examples include Bone, Hide, Organ, and Scrap.
An ability. Ignore any effects that make you skip the next hunt. When you are a returning survivor, gain {v}{v}.

When the final Hunt XP box is filled in, the survivor retires. Some disorders and severe injuries also force retirement. Retired survivors cannot depart, but still contribute to the total population of the settlement and may participate in settlement events and endeavors.
All survivors that endured the previous showdown are returning survivors.
Turn a card face up and examine it. (Do not play it.) Do not reshuffle a deck to reveal more cards than are in a deck.

A wanderer impairment. Goth cannot be killed. If she would die, she gains +1 understanding and inexplicably survives instead. The first time Goth inexplicably survives each lantern year, she archives all tokens, erases all filled injury level boxes, and heals all permanent injuries. Each subsequent time she inexplicably survives the same lantern year, return her to the settlement immediately with -1 disposition.
Rewards are gained by defeating monsters. They are listed on the monster's showdown story event. Gain rewards as a group, once per victorious showdown (unless stated otherwise).
A gear special rule. When you block or deflect a hit, gain {q} at the start of your next act. Limit once per round.
A survivor ability. This survivor gains +1 permanent strength and suffers -1 permanent evasion.

When beginning a showdown with the Lion Knight, these are distributed randomly to the survivors during the setup phase. They may move from one survivor to another during the showdown, but a survivor may never have more than one at a time. When a survivor dies, archive their role card unless playing with 5-6 players. In that case, a random survivor without a Role Card gains the dead survivor's role card. This modification continues until you are back to four survivors (then you archive the Role Cards of dead survivors as normal).
The Absolute constellation ability. If you are standing at the start of your act, reveal the top 2 cards of the AI deck and put them back in any order.

The Disintegration neurosis. When you depart, set your armor points at each hit location to 0 after factoring all bonuses. When you are a returning survivor, you devour another. Suffer -1 population, the settlement does not gain benefits of their death principle.
The showdown proceeds in rounds, consisting of the monster's turn followed by the survivors' turn. Rounds will continue until the monster or all the survivors are dead.
Once a settlement has innovated Pictograph, survivors may abandon a Hunt or Showdown Phase at any time. Follow the instructions on the Run Away story event.
A special rule. When a survivor hits 3+ times in a single attack, they Rush for that attack.

A Flower Knight gear card. This gear lets you take resources from the settlement storage back out onto a hunt and/or showdown. A Satchel allows the survivor to circumvent the Perishable resource rule.
A gear special rule. After the first critical wound in an attack, savage weapons cause 1 additional wound. This rule does not trigger on Impervious hit locations.
Gear with this keyword is a saw weapon. Survivors may not gain levels of saw weapon proficiency.
A gear special rule. Spend {m}. For the rest of the round, your attacks with this weapon gain +2 luck. Limit once per round.
A gear keyword. This gear is substantively crafted of scales.
Gear with this keyword is a scimitar weapon. Survivors may not gain levels of scimitar weapon proficiency.

After the settlement innovates (scout) Pictograph, the scout can glean new teachings from defeating a difficult foe. A scout discovery is performed after defeating a Level 3+ quarry monster. A specific scout discovery can only be performed once per campaign.

Scouts are survivors who bear the Dreaded Pack and the burden of retrieving the settlement's gear in case the party is defeated during the hunt or showdown. Each lantern year, the settlement may nominate a survivor to act as the scout for that hunt and showdown. If you do not have a scout, gear will not be returned to the settlement in the case of defeat. If a scout dies or is otherwise lost while hunting or in a showdown with a quarry monster but the remaining survivors are victorious, they carry the Dreaded Pack home. See the Scout rules (page 99) for more information.
A common resource keyword.
Gear with this keyword is a scythe weapon. Survivors may gain levels of Scythe weapon proficiency with this weapon only if they have certain expansions.

A gear special rule. Sealed gear has a bonus effect that can only be earned by training. A survivor can unseal the gear by declaring it as their weapon proficiency, forsaking the normal bonuses of selecting a weapon type. When the survivor reaches the specialization rank, they earn the effect listed after the Sealed special rule on the gear card. A survivor can only earn a gear's Sealed bonus once per lifetime. Example: A survivor declares Toxicimitar as their weapon proficiency (because it has a Sealed effect). When they reach rank 3 (specialization), they gain the Crescent Step secret fighting art.

Secret Fighting Arts are fighting arts that cannot be gained normally. Each secret fighting art has a corresponding card that describes the rules for using it. These count toward your fighting art maximum of 3.
A gear keyword. Gear cards with the seed keyword can be crafted only via their respective Seed Pattern recipes.

A type of pattern card obtained at the Drafting Table innovation. Many Seed Patterns require survivors with certain attributes or experiences, events, or other requisites to craft. Some may have temporary or permanent effects on survivors or the settlement. See the Seed Patterns section (page 96) for more information.
A gear special rule. Selfish gear cannot be in the same gear grid with any other gear with the "other" keyword.

The Survivalism neurosis. When you encourage another survivor, roll 1d10. On a 6+, you do not encourage. Keep your survival, and you cannot encourage again this round. If it is possible for your survivor to use Meat Shield to avoid harm, they must use it.

The Collectivism neurosis. While you are alive, increase the settlement's survival limit by 1. (Each Collectivist increases the limit.) When you depart, set your survival to 0 after applying all bonuses.

A Flower Knight story event. Survivors can perform Inspired Crafting to craft Flower Knight gear with the Flowers they harvest from the Flower Knight. They can also take special actions with the right innovations.
A gear special rule. A survivor must be insane to activate this gear.

An impairment unique to Wanderer Luck. Luck's fortune prevents him from dying. if Luck would die, he instead returns to the settlement with -1 disposition. When Luck departs with an Immortal survivor, he gains +1 disposition.

A typical session is comprised of three phases: Hunt Phase, Showdown Phase, and Settlement Phase. Some events may make survivors skip one or more of these phases. For example, Nemesis Encounters have no Hunt Phase.
A gear keyword listed on some armor cards. This means this armor is part of an armor set.
The unique collection of locations, innovations, principles, gear, resources, and survivors that represent the survivors' home. Survivors are at the settlement during the Settlement Phase.
The settlement board is located on the reverse side of the Hunt Board. The spaces on the board correspond to steps in the Settlement Phase to guide players along.
An event occurring during the Settlement Phase.

During the Settlement Phase, survivors experience settlement and story events, spend endeavors, craft gear, and determine which survivors depart on the next hunt. This is the only phase where survivors may change or rearrange their gear grids.
Helps the players keep track of the development of their settlement.
Contains sections of possible severe injuries to hit locations. Each hit that causes a severe injury prompts a roll on that location's severe injury table.

When survivors' armor points and injury levels are exhausted, they may accumulate temporary or permanent severe injuries from the severe injury table. When a survivor suffers permanent injuries, note the name and rules on your record sheet and adjust their attributes as necessary. Some injuries fill the Skip Next Hunt box on the survivor record sheet. Otherwise, severe injuries last until the end of the showdown and are marked by attribute tokens.

An ability. You control the settlement from the shadows. Each lantern year, you choose the departing survivors. You may nominate anyone to depart, even those who are retired or could not otherwise do so.
The Sunstalker's instinct. Described on the Sunstalker's showdown story event and basic action card.
A special type of movement. When you Shadow Walk, you may move through spaces survivors occupy without causing collision. (You cannot end your movement on spaces survivors occupy.)

The settlement may be able to propagate additional concepts of knowledge at the Forum. To share a specific knowledge, find its associated card and place it on the Forum. If an effect does not specify which knowledge is shared, draw a random card from the Knowledge deck to share. If the settlement does not have a Forum when you try to share Knowledge, nothing happens.
A gear special rule. Add 1d10 strength to each wound attempt using this gear. This d10 is not a wound roll, and cannot cause critical wounds nor automatically fail.
Gear with this keyword is a shield weapon. Survivors may gain levels of shield weapon proficiency with this weapon.
Used to represent the area where the survivors face the monster in battle. Specific rules for setting up the showdown board are found on each monster's showdown story event.
Generally, monster or survivors cannot move off the edge of the showdown board. Any knockback or full move effects that would bring a miniature past a board edge stops at the edge instead.
The part of a session where survivors face off against a monster. See individual monster showdown pages for instructions on how to start and end the Showdown Phase.
A component of each monster's showdown story event. Contains instructions for setting up terrain tiles and monster and survivor miniatures on the showdown board before a battle.
A gear special rule. During your act, you may spend an attribute token to gain {q} which must be spent immediately to activate a melee weapon and attack. Limit once per round.
A gear keyword. In certain situations, this can be used to harvest herbs.
A special survival action. Before performing an action against the King, spend 1 survival to hold your breath and focus on the void. You are hushed during that action.
A gear keyword. This gear is substantively crafted of silk.
A resource keyword. These resources can be used and refined to craft silk gear.
An impairment. When you activate a weapon to attack, choose either -2 accuracy or -3 strength for that attack.
An impairment. During the showdown, when you gain a bleeding token, also gain -1 evasion token.
After you Slam, spend {q} to move 1 space and activate a melee weapon with +2 strength. If you wound with a spear, apply that wound roll result to the next selected hit location this attack.
An ability. During the Aftermath, you may archive a resource to erase a permanent injury that another survivor suffered this showdown.

Fill in the Skip Next Hunt box on the survivor's record sheet. The survivor may not be selected as a departing survivor. After departing survivors are chosen, erase all filled Skip Next Hunt boxes on all survivor record sheets.
A gear special rule. Spend {m} and full move forward in a straight line. If you move 4+ spaces and stop adjacent to a monster, it suffers knock back 1 and -1 toughness until the end of the round.
The Dreamism neurosis. You cannot gain survival during the hunt or showdown.
An impairment. Your skull digs into your brain's pleasure center. Whenever you critically wound, you wince. After resolving the critical wound, you are knocked down.
A gear special rule. Slow weapons always have an attack speed of 1. Do not add speed modifiers.
The White Lion's instinct. Described on the White Lion's showdown story event and basic action card.
An ability. You may carry any number of soda rare gear outside of your gear grid. (All sodas you carry must be different.) You may give a soda gear to an adjacent survivor anytime during your act.

A special action. When the third space of the Solar Track is occupied by a face down AI card, perform the steps listed on that space. (Any effects that trigger on or after a Solar Flare occur at the appropriate time.)
A special tracker used in the Sunstalker expansion. This tracker helps determine the direction where light is coming from, the power level of the Sun, and directions to perform a Solar Flare.
A gear keyword. Able to be dissolved in liquid.
A survivor status card/ A survivor is singing only if they have a face up Song survivor status card.
An ability. Your Ballads cost 1 less to perform.
An ability. When you are knocked down, you may encourage yourself (even if you are deaf). If you do, gain +1 strength token.
An ability. When a survivor is named, they gain a random knowledge.

Atnas's blade bursts from its sheath. End all other ongoing actions. Survivors take turns flipping and resolving one of their Sword Craft cards. Continue cycling through survivors, one card at a time, until all Sword Craft cards are resolved. If a survivor dies, continue to resolve Sword Craft cards on their corpse before removing their miniature from the showdown board.
Gear with this keyword is a spear weapon. Survivors may gain levels of spear weapon proficiency with this weapon.
An endeavor action that survivors can take to gain a specified innovation. This does not count towards your settlement's usual "Innovate once per lantern year" rules.

Special Showdowns interrupt the Settlement Phase. After they conclude (regardless of Victory or Defeat), the Settlement Phase returns to the Update Death Count step (5). Survivors that embarked on a Special Showdown are not considered returning survivors. Do not advance the timeline by a lantern year, generate endeavors, or draw a new settlement event card.
An ability. When you consume and archive something, roll 1d10. On an 8+, it comes out the other end intact! Do not archive it.
The number of attack rolls (number of dice rolled). Usually determined by a monster AI card's attack profile or speed on a survivor's weapon.

Speed is added to a survivor's weapon speed or a monster's attack profile speed to determine the number of attack rolls. If speed is negative, subtract it from the number of dice rolled for an attack. A monster or survivor attack with less than one speed still has one attack roll. Weapons with the Slow keyword cannot benefit from positive speed bonuses.
The Spidicules's instinct. Described on the Spidicules's showdown story event and basic action card.
The Ambitionism neurosis. When you are a returning survivor, if the settlement's CC did not increase, skip the next hunt.
An ability. Ignore knocked down effects of brain trauma, disorders, and Intimidate actions.
If the survivors move into this space (including starting the showdown), apply the rules listed on the hunt board.
An ability. When you encourage, gain +2 accuracy tokens until the end of the round.
An ability. Once per showdown, you may archive a Sword Beetle vermin resource to give your attacks Sharp for the remainder of the showdown.
A gear keyword. This item has a strong odor.
Survivors become stinky as a result of carrying gear with the stinky keyword in their gear grids, or through status cards, disorders, or other effects that make them stinky targets.
An ability. Before making a wound attempt with Fist & Tooth, you may discard another drawn {N} to double the wound roll result.
An ability. When a survivor adopts a philosophy, they draw an additional card and select one to adopt.

An event which impacts the settlement/survivors. Common triggers include: the settlement timeline, survivor milestones in Hunt XP/courage/understanding, monster cards, and settlement events. When {s} appears, trigger the story event by turning to the appropriate page in the rulebook and following its instructions.
An ability. You cannot be knocked down during a showdown with a Nemesis monster.
An ability. Once per showdown, you may roll 1d10. On a 3+, gain the priority target token and the monster gains a +1 damage token.
An ability. At the start of each of your acts, you may choose to gain +1 survival and 2 bleeding tokens.
Straggler is a survivor condition gained during hunt events that affects survivor while resolving the hunt event.

Strain fighting arts are special fighting arts that are added to your game via strain milestones. A campaign can have a maximum of 5 strain fighting arts in the fighting arts deck. If you would add a 6th strain fighting art, replace an old strain fighting art (remove it from the deck) with the new one instead. If any survivors have the removed fighting art, they still keep it. When you start a new campaign, if you have earned more than 5 strain fighting arts, you must randomly determine which 5 to add to your fighting arts deck. Any other earned strain fighting arts should be stored in your game box for later campaigns.

A strain milestone describes a rare milestone event that, if reached, will permanently alter the future of your Kingdom Death: Monster campaigns. During the Check Milestones step (#6) of the settlement phase, check to see if you have achieved a strain's Milestone's Condition. If you have, resolve its Permanent Effect and remove the achieved strain milestone card from your game. It can never be used again.
Resource cards only gained in specific circumstances. Strange monster resources are not shuffled into monster resource decks.
Strength is added to the result of a wound attempt. If strength is a negative number, subtract is from the wound attempt result.
The number a weapon adds to wound attempts.
A special rule. You can use this while frenzied.
An icon used in the Sunstalker expansion. This symbol is equal to the number of face down cards currently on the Solar Track.
A type of hit location. This hit location is unusually hard. If a survivor attempts to wound one of these locations with a frail weapon, it is destroyed and archived at the end of the attack.
A survivor ability. You may spend {A} to freely exchange any tokens with adjacent survivors who have Super Hair.

A type of survival action. When opportunity permits, a survivor may spend 1 survival to Surge. Gain +1 {q} which must be spent immediately. This allows them to activate a weapon, interact with terrain, use gear, and anything else spending an activation allows them to do. Resolve the results of Surge (including any monster reactions) before resuming the turn. Each survivor may only Surge once per round, and only if the settlement has the Inner Lantern innovation.
A gear special rule. When your wound attempt total surpasses the monster's toughness by X or more, the monster suffers an additional wound.

Survival is the desperate desire to cling to life. Survival points are gained and lost throughout the campaign. They are spent to perform extraordinary feats and change your fate. Update the survival box on your survivor record sheet as it is gained and lost.
Survival actions are the most common uses for survival points. In the core game, there are 5: Dodge, Encourage, Dash, Surge, and Endure.

Survival limit is the maximum amount of survival a survivor may have. Survival limit is recorded on the settlement record sheet. Innovations and events raise the settlement's survival limit. At the start of the campaign, the survival limit is 1. Survival gained over the survival limit is lost.

The only times that survivors may Dash or Surge. Survival opportunities exist at the following times: during flows on monster AI cards, between actions on the survivors' turn, before performing reactions, after critical wound effects, or when a monster is knocked down.
Represents the permanent status of a survivor. Some sections include: attributes, Hunt XP, Weapon Proficiency and permanent changes.

Special (S) AI cards that track conditions for an individual survivor rather than the monster. When a survivor gains a survivor status card, place it next to their gear grid. The card's effects apply only to them. Some status cards change and need to be tracked. Some grant survivors unique actions. If a monster's story event has a Survivor Status card in its setup, all survivors gain the card at the start of the showdown.

An ability. Once per round, you may Surge without spending survival. If you do, the activation gained must be used to activate a weapon. You may use Sweet Battle even if your settlement cannot normally Surge. You may also use Sweet Battle when you have no survival and/or cannot spend survival. This does not let you Surge more than once per round.
Gear with this keyword is a sword weapon. Survivors may gain levels of sword weapon proficiency with this weapon.

A special deck used by Atnas. These cards are not shuffled into the monster's {O} deck. When instructed, deal Sword Craft cards directly to a survivor. Always deal Sword Craft cards face down unless otherwise specified. You may not look at face down Sword Craft cards unless an effect instructs you to.
A gear keyword. Symbols are strange gear traditionally gained through the Death Reading story event.

A type of attack on {O}. Synchronic attacks have a singular target but also strike larger areas of effect that cause damage or effects to other survivors caught in the zone. These additional survivors are not considered targets.

An arc survivor attribute. When an arc survivor makes a roll on the severe injury table, subtract 1 from their result for each systemic pressure they have. Non-arc survivors are unaffected by systemic pressure.

Tactics are often found in expansions with Knight monsters. They provide survivors with new ways to fight, using what they've learned from fighting Knights. Tactics are drawn from a Tactics deck by any badge-wearers at the start of the showdown. During the showdown, the badge-wearer may use their current Tactic(s) to help defeat their foes.
The recipient of an attack or effect. Some attacks or effects may impact survivors other than the target.
The principle knowledge of an arc survivor's philosophy. This knowledge may not be removed from the arc survivor record sheet unless its associated philosophy is abandoned.

Represent terrain that can be encountered during the Showdown Phase and contain rules for how monsters and survivors interact with them. Terrain cards place one or more terrain tiles on the showdown board.

Terrain tiles are placed on the Showdown Board to represent physical features. The type and amount of terrain added to the Showdown Board is determined by the terrain card specified in the setup section of each monster's showdown story event.
A survivor status. you are guardless and ignore any bonuses to brain trauma rolls. If you have at least 1 insanity, you may spend ~q~ to archive this card.

terms.term: The Forest Wants What It Wants
terms.definition: A special hunt event card that replaces/covers Overwhelming Darkness. When survivors encounter this space, trigger The Forest Wants What It Wants story event instead of the Overwhelming Darkness story event. The space retains all of its normal rules and cannot be skipped or ignored.
A knowledge special rule. An inkling of an idea that currently has no effect. With enough observation, the theory may advance into something useful.
The Hand's instinct. Described on The Hand's showdown story event and basic action card.
A survivor impairment. You cannot gain insanity for any reason.
A threat is any survivor that is not knocked down or using special gear, terrain, or abilities to prevent being considered a threat.
Gear with this keyword is a thrown weapon. Survivors may not gain levels of thrown weapon proficiency.
An ability. Once a lifetime, on a hunt board space after Overwhelming Darkness, in place of rolling a random hunt event, use "100" as your result.
Tracks the number of lantern years since the establishment of your settlement on the Settlement Record Sheet. Trigger story and settlement events as the timeline advances.
An ability. When you are a returning survivor, gain +1 {t}.

A Bone Eater status. While a Bone Eater is toned, it suffers -3 movement and gains +3 damage. After performing its Basic Action (including any drawn opportunity cards), the Bone Eater is no longer toned. Track this by placing a toned token (black lantern tokens) under the monster.
A gear keyword. Some tools trigger story events or grant bonuses.

A special survivor action. Before you attack the Screaming Antelope, spend 1 survival to aim for the monster's broken teeth. If a reaction during that attack would archive a survivor's weapon, ignore it.
An arc survivor attribute. When an arc survivor makes a roll on the brain trauma table, subtract 1 from their result for each torment they have. Non-arc survivors are unaffected by torment..
Toughness is the number a wound attempt total must meet or exceed to successfully wound a monster.
A direction used in reference to another point on the showdown board, such as a monster, survivor, terrain tile., or board edge.
A type of monster AI card. Describes permanent changes to the characteristics or behaviors of the monster. Trait cards are not discarded at the end of the monster turn.

A special action at the Gormchymy settlement location. Spend 2 organ resources and roll 1d10. Add 1d10 for each Gormchymy innovation in your settlement. Add the roll results and gain the corresponding gear or resources.

A type of monster hit location. A trap cancels all the attacker's hits, ends their attack, and causes the monster to stand, in addition to the actions listed on the card. After the Trap's actions are resolved, shuffle the entire hit location deck.
Part of a monster's attack profile. Indicates that an Attack Effect is part of this attack.
A gear special rule. This gear is portable enough to carry without being an encumbrance. A survivor may carry up to 1 Trinket gear outside of their gear grid.

Move the mosnter until it passes through the target. Then, stop and turn to face the target. Any survivors the monster passes through (other than the target) suffer the decapitation severe head injury.
A survivor ability. When you gain this ability, set your systemic pressure and torment to 0. You cannot gain systemic pressure or torment.
The first part of a round, when the monster acts. The monster controller should apply any "at start of turn" effects, draw and play AI cards, then apply any "at end of turn" effects.

The second part of a round is the survivors' turn. During the survivors' turn, survivors act one at a time, each completing their entire act before another survivor may take their act. Survivors may choose to act in any order.

The Gambler constellation ability. You cannot carry two-handed gear. On a Perfect hit, your right hand pulses. Gain +5 insanity and +1 luck for the attack. However, for each natural 1 rolled when attempting to hit, your left hand shakes. Suffer 5 brain damage and -1 luck for the attack.
A gear keyword. This weapon requires two hands to use. Some gear and rules do not work with two-handed weapons.
A survivor abillity. You may only wear Cloth (no other armor or accessories). Gain +2 strength from your resolve.

A special rule. If the survivor would die, roll 1d10. On a result of 6+, instead the survivor lives. If this roll occurs from the survivor having a lethal amount of bleeding tokens, the survivor will not die until they gain another bleeding token.

A survivor attribute listed on the survivor record sheet. Represents a survivor's insight about the world. Reaching an understanding level of 3 will trigger the Insight Story Event, while reaching a level of 9 will trigger the White Secret Story Event.

A special survival action. Before you attack the Phoenix, spend 1 survival. For this attack, draw all hit locations face down, only revealing them as you resolve each one. Ignore Rewind for this attack.
A gear special rule. While you have any deflect tokens, this weapon has +2 speed and -4 strength.
Add +1d10 strength to a wound attempt. After a wound attempt is rolled you may roll the Death Die and add the result to the strength of your wound attempt.
A gear special rule. A settlement may only have one copy of this gear card at a time.

The Impermanism neurosis. All your weapons, except Fist & Tooth, have Frail while in your gear grid. If you wound a Super-Dense hit location with Fist & Tooth, suffer the broken arm severe injury at the end of the attack.
A gear special rule. When this survivor draws a trap card, roll 1d10. On a result of 6+, ignore the trap. Discard it and shuffle the hit location deck.
A gear special rule. Replace all wound rolls with a 1d10 roll. On a 1-5, fail to wound, on 6+ wound. You cannot cause a critical wound while using this rule.
A gear special rule. If any attack dice roll results are 1, the weapon causes 1 random damage to the survivor for each 1 rolled. Continue the attack as normal.
A survivor's sense of pride and self-worth. When a survivor suffers a severe injury, they archive all their vanity tokens and set their vanity to 0.
A type of hit location. Against stronger Crimson Crocodiles, these locations may become problematic.
A token that inflicts wounds on a monster as they are accumulated.
Vermin resources can be found in Bug Patches during showdowns or as a result of events. Vermin cards describe how each vermin can be used. Vermin can also be used in the Cooking Story Event.
A survivor ability. During the Aftermath, gain +1 Hunt XP.

A damage type. Hits that cause vibration damage cannot be dodged. do not roll hit location dice. Add the damage of all hits or sources together and deal it to hit locations of your choice 1 point at a time. After a survivor is done resolving their vibration damage, they archive all fragile gear.

Part of a monster's Aftermath. Use this result if the monster is defeated. Add that monster to the Defeated Monsters section of the settlement record sheet. If a Nemesis monster was defeated, update the Nemesis monster section as well.

A gear special rule. If the settlement has any gear with this rule, the survivors cannot depart without this gear. If the survivor holding Vital gear perishes before the showdown, another survivor must pick up the Vital gear (discarding gear to make room in their grid if needed).

A showdown special rule. When a survivor performs encourage or any effect that describes them roaring, yelling, or screaming, their head explodes as the sound is converted to force. They suffer the head explosion severe injury.
A survivor hit location. Damage to the waist beyond the heavy injury level results in a roll on the Waist section of the Severe Injury table.
An ability. You never suffer the effects of cold. On Arrival, gain +1 movement and +1 speed tokens. When you are a returning survivor, +5 {v}. Only you may spend these endeavors.
The Rust constellation ability. Your bleeding tokens are also +1 evasion tokens.
A type of gear card. Weapon types in the core game include axe, blow, club, dagger, fist & tooth, grand, katar, shield. spear, sword, twilight sword and whip.

Achieved when a survivor has eight or more levels of weapon proficiency. When any survivor attains a weapon mastery, add that mastery to the settlement as an innovation. All survivors automatically gain the Specialist bonus for that weapon type in addition to any weapon proficiencies they already have.

A survivor attribute listed on the survivor record sheet. Weapon proficiency represents a survivor's skill with a weapon type. May be earned for the following weapon types: axe, bow, club, dagger, fist & tooth, grand, katar, shield, spear, sword, twilight sword and whip. After reaching the first Hunt XP milestone, survivors can declare a weapon type to gain weapon proficiency in. A survivor must first declare a weapon type before departing on a hunt (write it in the space on the record sheet) and then wound a monster at least once during a showdown with that weapon type in order to gain levels of weapon proficiency.
Achieved when a survivor has three or more levels of weapon proficiency. Survivors develop new skills which often empower that weapon,
Wearing a piece of gear refers to a piece of armor or accessory gear in your gear grid. If an effect restricts the type of gear you can wear, you cannot place that type of gear into your gear grid.
Gear with this keyword is a whip weapon. Survivors may gain levels of whip weapon proficiency with this weapon.
A survivor ability. Once per showdown, you may archive a Cyclops Fly vermin resource to discard the Trap and reshuffle the hit location deck.
The Blessed First neurosis. While Luck is on the showdown board, all other survivor's weapons gain Unwieldy.

A special severe injury table that the Necromancer rolls on in place of the traditional severe injury table. Refer to the back side of the Necromancer secret fighting art card for this table. (Specified severe injuries remain unchanged.)
When a survivor successfully wounds a monster, remove the top card from its AI Deck and place it in the Wound Stack. If the AI Deck is empty, shuffle the AI discard to create a new deck first.

The total power of a survivor's hit. Add the wound roll result (1d10) to the attacking weapon's strength, along with any other strength modifiers. If a wound attempt total meets or exceeds the monster's toughness, then the hit location is wounded.
Listed on some monster hit location cards. An action that a monster performs in response to a successful wound attempt at certain hit locations.

Represents the variable ferocity of a survivor's hit. Roll 1d10 and add the result to the wound attempt. The result of this d10 (adding luck modifiers) determines whether or not a critical wound is caused on locations with critical wound effects.
A survivor impairment. When you activate a weapon or terrain, suffer 1 damage to the arms hit location.
A number (X) of ten-sided dice. The included dice feature a Lantern on the "10" face.
The indicated area for actions and reactions on some monster AI and hit location cards.
